loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a mother of five school-age children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kwekwe has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Kwekwe dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years.

Helen has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. to sell. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Margaret has operated a business, selling clothes and shoes at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 20,000 that she is requesting, Margaret wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, drinks, bread, detergent, soap, candy, etc., to continue attending well to her customers.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a second-hand clothing business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy inventory to keep in her store such as shirts, pants, long shorts, long-sleeve and short-sleeve tops. She opened her business in 2006 with her own working capital of 750 USD. Juliana is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, long shorts, long-sleeve and short-sleeve tops

loans.name: Karmegam Shg - Anaikudam Group

texts.en:
Kavitha, 35 years old, is a leader of the Karmegam Self-Help Group (holding a board with SHG name) which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Anaikudam village, Ariyalur district. Kavitha lives in her own house with her children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Kavitha has been taking loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loan on time. 

Kavitha wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs INR 1400. It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone. (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.

Kavitha and the other member of the group are requesting a loan to buy  smokeless stoves and have healthier lives.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and three go to school. She sells milk at the market, both retail and wholesale  She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She takes care of additional family members and she works seven days a week. 

Alex has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy jerrycans of milk, loaves of bread and Blueband margarine. Her major challenge includes transportation and perishability of milk. She aspires to educate her children to university level and also to buy another fridge. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of milk, loaves of bread, and Blueband margarine

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old, married, and has three children going to school. Her husband is a farmer growing rice on their farm. To further meet their children's needs, they also have a livestock business. Erlinda wants to help her husband uplift their standard of living – that’s why she looks for any kind of decent source of income.

Erlinda operates a retailing business in their village. Her earnings serve as finances for their daily expenditures. Sometimes there is not enough income to cover all their daily expenditures, but through saving and proper budgeting, Erlinda is able to sustain the family. At this point, Erlinda wishes for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy grocery items to sell in their village. She hopes to earn higher income from the business so that she will no longer have to budget hard just to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her village.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 46 years old and lives at Solana with her family. She has four children. Her spouse is a carpenter. To add to the family's income, she sells plastic and glassware to her neighbors and in nearby villages, too. She wants to buy more utensils to sell; that is why she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more kitchen utensils to sell such as basins, pails and stock pots. This will increase her turnover and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en: Sabas is a businessman in Larena. He has been running a "carenderia" (eatery) business for almost 10 years. From this long experience in selling, he already has a lot of knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, he still gets more customers than the competition due to his good salesmanship and characteristic effort. He has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for his family. At present, he needs additional capital to purchase raw ingredients for his "carenderia" (eatery) business, so he has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for his "carenderia" (eatery) business

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Flor De Campo" está conformado por personas trabajadoras, amables, honestas quienes agradecen a VisionFund México por brindarles la confianza y oportunidad de recibir un préstamo para invertir nuevamente en su actividad.

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron los integrantes del primer ciclo de los cuales, sólo continúan 4, para ellos "Flor de Campo" es una manera de expresar la libertad que sienten al vivir en una comunidad rodeados de árboles y cerros. Uno de los atributos y beneficios de la región es la siembra y cosecha de café y de caña de azúcar que permite a los habitantes desarrollar su vida cotidiana en torno a estas actividades económicas. De la misma manera, la mayoría de los habitantes siembran café en sus pequeños terrenos para autoconsumo. 

Los integrantes del grupo son: Maria -Venta De Abarrotes, Alejandro - Venta De Sandalias, Tomasa - Venta De Abarrotes, Aurora - Venta De Comida, Paula - Venta De Dulces, Juana - Venta De Pan, Grisel - Venta De Ropa, Tirso - Reparación de Relojes, Minerva - Venta De Anojitos y Emma - Venta De Antojitos.

Don Tirso es una persona muy trabajadora quien desde hace ya 6 años se ha dedicado a vender y componer relojes de pulso o de pared. También se dedica a limpiar solares y plantaciones de café. Para realizar su trabajo, su herramienta principal es el guiro (cortacésped) que utiliza pera limpiar el terreno. Al terminar de cortar la maleza, la recoge con un rastrillo y deja todo listo para comenzar la siembra. De esta manera, satisface a sus clientes quienes lo buscan por su buen servicio. Con las ganancias obtenidas, don Tirso sustenta los gastos de su hogar y cubre en tiempo y forma cada uno de los pagos correspondientes al préstamo. Comenta que algunas veces acude al corte del café, para trabajar recogiendo los granos lo cual significa otro ingreso para su hogar. En esta ocasión, quiere utilizar su crédito para comprar más relojes de pulso para dama y caballero, así como más relojes de pared.

*En la imagen: don Tirso viste una playera rayada.
texts.en:
The loan group "Flor de Campo" is made up of hardworking people who are friendly and honest, who are thankful to VisionFund Mexico for trusting them with the opportunity to recieve a loan to invest in their business.

The name of the group was chosen by the members during the first loan cycle, of whom only 4 are continuing. For them, "Flor de Campo" [Flower of the Field] is a way to express the freedom they feel because they live in a community surrounded by trees and hills. One of the attributes and benefits of the region is the cultivation and harvesting of coffee and sugarcane, which allows the inhabitants to make their living in these areas of business. The majority of the inhabitants plant coffee on their small pieces of land for their own consumption.

The members of the group are: Maria--grocery sales; Alejandro--sandal sales; Tomasa--grocery sales; Aurora--food sales; Paula--sweets sales; Juana--bread sales; Grisel--clothing sales; Tirso--watch repair; Minerva--snacks sales; Emma--snacks sales.

Tirso is a very hardworking person who has worked for the past 6 years at selling and repairing wrist watches and wall clocks. He also weeds yards and coffe farms. To do his work, his main tool is his lawn mower, which he uses to tidy the land. When he's done cutting the weeds, he rakes them and leaves things ready for planting. In this way he satisfies his customers, who seek him out because of his quality service. With his earnings, Tirsa provides for his household's expenses and covers each one of his loan payments on time. He explains that sometimes he works in the coffee harvest by picking the beans, which means another source of income for his family. He wants to use his loan this time to buy more wrist watches for men and women, and also more wall clocks.

In the photo, Tirso is wearing a striped polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy wrist watches and wall clocks.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en: Marianne is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She raises hogs and sells housewares. Marianne manages her business well and wants to improve the growth of her hogs for more income. Marianne is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed, rice bran, and medicine for her hogs. This will nourish her hogs so that she can sell them for a higher price someday. She will also invest additional revenue to buy more plastic and glassware to sell.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice bran, and medicine for hogs

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Lorlyn has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lorlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra has been working on her own farm to make a living. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loans used for farming costs. She borrowed recently to for pay weeding maintenance costs and fertilizer. Hoping to gain more with her investments, Isidra has a dream of improving her living situation in the future.

loans.use: to pay for weeding maintenance costs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Chrish

texts.en:
Mary Chrish has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for six years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Mary Chrish would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 40,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mary Chrish hopes to grow her business further so that it will soon become a grocery store. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.en:
Maruja works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Maruja requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Shg Group

texts.en:
Saraswati, the lady standing first from left in the first row, is 45 years old and has two children. She lives in a small village in the Koraput district in Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years ago, she started a grocery shop where she sells rice, lentils, potatoes, wheat flour, onions, spices, soap etc. She purchases these items in town with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of products, depending on the demand in the village. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafer, toilet cleaner etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting the loan with a group of nine members who all are women who live in the same community. They named their group Maa Gayatri Shg.

loans.use: To purchase detergent, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafer, and toilet cleaner for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an embroidery machine, and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
This is Madel. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting her personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Madel dreams of managing her own bar and restaurant. She still hopes for her children to finish their studies and that they will be able to acquire better job opportunities. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work and to find strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and maintenance needed in her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 60 years old, married and has four children. She manages a store for income. She hopes to increase her merchandise but has insufficient funds. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000. She will use her loan to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar and soap to sell in her store. Aside from managing a store, she also raises hogs for additional income. She will invest additional revenue in improving her businesses so she will be able to save funds for her family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Grupo M De Yondece Group

texts.es:
Graciela M es la representante del grupo “M de Yondece” platica que tiene 27 años de edad y está casada con el señor Samuel desde hace nueve años. Ellos han formado una familia con dos niños aunque actualmente sólo uno de ellas asiste a la escuela. Graciela se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos desde hace siete años; compra los animales desde pequeños para y con las ganancias de las ventas ayuda con los gastos del hogar y la educación. “Inicié el negocio porque era más fácil criar borreguitos que salir a trabajar; no me gustaba dejar a mis hijos solitos sin mis cuidados”. Graciela está solicitando un préstamo a VisionFund México para comprar más borreguitos ya que por el momento no tienen ninguno; recientemente vendió todos los que tenía para poder solventar los gastos de curación de su hija quien sufrió un accidente. Gracias a ello, la pequeña ya se encuentra mejor. Graciela dice tener muy buena suerte con este tipo de actividad porque no se le mueren, ni se le enferman los borregos y crecen muy rápido, además de que le encanta criar animales. Además, Graciela aprovecha el campo que rodea su casa para sacar los borregos a pastar cuando tiene oportunidad y así no invertir en alimento extra. La meta de esta maravillosa mujer es poder llegar a tener un gran rebaño. 
Los integrantes de grupos son Graciela L, Fátima y Florentino quienes invertirán en abarrotes; María de la Luz y Adela, en cerdos y Celestina, en borregos.
texts.en:
Graciela M. is the representative of the "M de Yondece" loan group. She tells us she is 27 years old and has been married to Samuel for nine years. They have formed a family with two children, only one of whom is currently in school. Graciela has been raising and fattening sheep since she was 7 years old. She buys them when they are young, and with the earnings from their sales she helps out with the household and education expenses. "I started the business because it was easier to raise young sheep than to go out to work; I don't like to leave my children alone without my care." 

Graciela is requesting a loan from VisionFund Mexico to buy more lambs because she doesn't have any right now. She recently sold all the ones she had to pay for her daughter's medical expenses because she suffered an accident. Because of the this, the little one is now better. Graciela says she has very good luck with this type of business because the sheep don't die on her, nor do they get sick. They grow very quickly and, also, she loves to raise animals. Graciela also takes advantage of the field around her house to graze her sheep so she doesn't have to buy extra feed. The goal of this wonderful woman is to be able to have a large herd.

The members of the group are Graciela L. and Fátima and Florentio, who will invest in groceries; María de la Luz and Adela, who will buy pigs; and Celestina, who will buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy young sheep.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario previously accessed an 9,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruits. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also sells fresh chicken for additional income.

Rosario would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosario dreams that her fruit stand will become more fruitful and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of fruits to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
This is Oliva, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a worker abroad and is a mother to their children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Oliva operates a tricycle transportation business. She has one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and to maintain the tricycle.

Oliva hopes to have more tricycles and a store of her own. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 37 years old, married and has eight children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Liza has a fishing business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Liza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 65 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Matilde has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: After Sami finished successful repayment of the installments of the first loan which was given by Kiva lenders, he applied for another loan of 160,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase the rest of the spare parts he needs for his bus. With the first loan, Sami purchased some of spare parts for his bus. With those spare parts, the bus worked better than the past. Sami warmly thanks Kiva lenders for their first loan and he hopes to be able to finance this loan.

loans.use: to buy the rest of the spare parts he needs for his bus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is earning well with his transportation service and is able to meet the needs of his family. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for his business. To buy new set of tires, Angel took a loan recently from GDMPC. While saving a portion of his income for any future family emergencies, Angel plans to buy a new motorcycle to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en: Jordan is married with three children. He operates a transportation services business while at the same working in a private institution for a living. For many years running this, it has helped provide for their daily expenditures while waiting for his salary. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy new tires and motor accessories. In the future, Jordan wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and motor accessories.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 62 years old. She is married with nine children, one of whom in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Nida has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a single mother of five school-age children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyamvula has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Nyamvula dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 38 years old and is living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a mobile shop for a couple of years and earning sufficient income. He can troubleshoot and sell mobile accessories such as chargers, bodies, and data cables and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. 

Nowadays, due to increase in demand for mobile accessories and for recharging, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into the business because he already has spent all of his savings on household expenses. Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories, components for troubleshooting, and extra credit for the recharge facility. She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and components.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She earns a living through her retail business, particularly used clothing. She has accessed a loan from Paglaum MPC for the needed capitalization to restock her "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business. She hopes to double her income to sufficiently provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to restock her "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Moyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia Nemecia pertenece al banco comunal LAS ROSAS DE MOYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maras, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 55 años de edad tiene 02 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diaria con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, albañil, restaurante.
La socia que sale a la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nemecia belongs to Las Rosas de Moyoc communal bank. The bank is located in Maras district, Urubamba province, and Cusco department.  She is 55 years old, has 2 children, and is single. She spends part of her days with her business raising small animals. She has been doing this work for a good number of years, which is going well for her due to the dedication that she puts into her business each day. She also works in a grocery store business. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She asks for the loan to purchase guinea pigs.

She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and commits to making the established payments.

The other members work in agriculture, a grocery store, construction, and a restaurant. 

The member who is in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 53 años de edad, es viudo, vive en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque; él goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos.

Mario se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 5 años de antiguedad en el negocio; él solicita préstamo para la compra de un número mayor de cerdos y alimento de engorde para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hará crecer su negocio, obtendrá más ingresos y sus ganancias creceran con que va a poder mejorar también su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is 53 years old, a widower, and lives in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region. He enjoys good personal and work references from his neighbors.

Mario works raising and selling pigs, and has more than 5 years in this business. He asks for the loan to purchase a large number of pigs and fodder to fatten them. In this way, he will make his business grow, get more income, and his profits will increase, with which he will be able to improve his quality of life, as well.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of pigs and fodder to fatten them.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla, tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija  con quien vive  en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Su  negocio es una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, huevos, productos enlatados, jabón, pastas, refrescos, churros, condimentos, productos de higiene etc.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años en su casa. Anteriormente realizaba trabajos en agricultura en el cultivo de cardamomo con su familia.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 lempiras para invertirlo  en el negocio de pulpería en  la compra de granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, churros, azúcar, manteca, pan, huevos y otros abarrotes. Su objetivo es aumentar el inventario, clientes e ingresos y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en: Karla, 22, is a single mother. She has a daughter who lives with her in a village in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Her business is a grocery store where she sells basic family foods. She sells rice, sugar, butter, flour, eggs, canned goods, ham, pasta, cold drinks, churros, condiments, hygiene products, etc.  She has had this business for 3 years in her house. Previously, she worked in agriculture, growing cardamom with her family. The loan that she has requested is for 10,000 lempiras to invest in the grocery business, by the purchase of basic grains, meat, cold drinks, churros, sugar, butter, bread, eggs, and other groceries. Her goal is to increase her inventory, customers, and income, and grow as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meats, cold drinks, churros, sugar, butter, bread, eggs, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es: José tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 7 años, 13 años y 18 años de edad. José es un hombre que se gana la vida trabajando como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo. Él es un hombre visionario quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. José ha tomado la decisión de solicitar esté  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo dado que desea encementar el piso de la vivienda y reparar el baño sanitario.
texts.en: José is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner, and their three children ages 7, 13 and 18 years old. José is a man who has earned his living as a day laborer for a long time. He is a visionary man who does everything in his reach to give his family better living conditions. José has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, and brick since he wants to finish the floor of his house and repair the bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and brick to finish the floor of his house and repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles and wood

loans.name: Flamina

texts.en: Flamina is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $1,500.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, and biscuits

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 48 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Rosario works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, such as soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

Rosario has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Armonía Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARMONIA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papel higiénico, venta de frutas, elaboración de colchones, tejido de polainas, venta de golosinas, venta de haba tostada, venta de condimentos, costura de almohadas, elaboración de colchones de algodón, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de colchones y almohadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su madre hace cinco años con la finalidad de generar mayor economía económica. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente en sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el empoderamiento que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The  “ARMONIA” communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alato Lima, and is made up of 10 members and led by officers, of whom Ana is the president. The businesses that the bank members carry on are varied and include toilet paper sales, fruit sales, making quilts, and food sales. 
 
The loan she is now taking out is to increase her working capital (purchase fabric in bulk) that she will get from the sale people n the city of EL ALto and later will sell in her retail space. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to economically support her studies. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings and the empowerment that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and girls' dresses

loans.name: Eddy Javier

texts.es:
Eddy tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto con su conyugue e hijos, en el caserio de Laynas, donde sus pobladores se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia, caserio de clima calurosos ubicado en el distrito de la Matanza, provincia de Morropon, departamento de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Eddy se dedica a la agricultura, ya que siembra Maíz, y lo comercializa en su misma zona, adicionalmente en su tiempo libre se dedica a prestar servicios de Mototaxi, en su caserío. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4000 nuevos soles para utilizarlo en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para la siembra y posterior cosecha de maíz. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora de su producto y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en venderlo a un buen precio lo que aumetará sus ingresos, mejorará sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia también.
texts.en:
Eddy is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse and children, in the hamlet of Laynas, where the residents work in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry. The hamlet has a warm climate and is located in Matanza district, Morropon province, Piura department, on the north coast of Perú. 
 
Eddy works in agriculture and plants corn and sells it in the same zone. In addition, in his free time, he works offering motorcycle taxi services in his village.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 4000 nuevols soles to use in agricultural work, applying and adding the phytosanitary products, fertilizer, and labor costs for planting and, later, harvesting. In this way, it will help with the improvements of the product, and in the end will have better production, a better quality product, which he won't have any trouble selling it at a good price, which will increase his income, he will improve his profits and to that end, in turn the quality of life for himself and his family, as well.

loans.use: to purchase applications and additions of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and labor costs to plant and harvest the corn.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala belongs to a poor family. She lives with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories such as doors and windows, which are usable in houses. He has also been providing door-to-door services to weld broken iron accessories.

A few days ago, his welding plant became out of order due to overheating and it needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant and accessories such as iron rods, soldering and welding rods, but does not have cash on hand due to excess household expenses.  Therefore, Ghazala has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so her son would be able to buy the desired inventory to continue manufacturing.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, soldering and welding rods for manufacturing.

loans.name: Gilberto Jose

texts.es: Con el crédito anterior Gilberto pudo avanzar en las mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, y de este modo garantiza mejores condiciones de vida para su familia. Con este nuevo crédito que está solicitando invertirá en la compra de productos para vender en el cafetín que tiene junto a su esposa en un colegio. Ya tienen varios años de tener este negocio, el que empezaron con un canasto en las afueras del colegio, y todo esto lo han logrado a través de los créditos que han solicitado y del esfuerzo que han hecho para tener una mejor administración. Gilberto sigue dedicándose también al negocio de fotografía, pero este negocio es esporádico, solamente cuando surgen eventos o a finales de año, para las graduaciones de los colegios.
texts.en: With the previous loan, Gilberto was able to get ahead on the structural improvements on his house, and in this way guarantee better living conditions for his family. With this new loan that he is asking for, he will invest in the purchase of products to sell in the cafeteria that he has with his wife in a school. He has had this business for some years. They began with a basket outside the school, and they have managed everything through the loans that they have requested and the efforts that they have made to have better administration.  Gilberto continues working in photography, also, but this business is sporadic, only when events come up or at the end of the year, for school graduations.

loans.use: to invest in products for his general store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 53 años de edad, es conviviente; vive con su familia, cuenta con servicios públicos(agua y luz); su comunidad es pequeña, los pobladores se dedican al comercio de agricultura y a la ganadería; está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropon, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Juana es la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores de corral; su esposo es agricultor. Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio de Picanteria, pues como vende las bebidas que prepara en su domicilio quiere atender a su público también con piqueos como ceviches, chicharrones, anticuchos, entre otros; lo que le va a permitir atender con una mayor calidad y variedad de productos a sus clientes, va a aumentar sus ingresos y por ende su ganancias creceran, y de esta manera su calidad de vida y la de su esposo también mejorarán.
texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and is a live-in partner; she lives with her family. She's responsible for the public utilities (water and electricity). Her community is small. The residents work in the agriculture and livestock industry. It's situated in the district of Buenos Aires, province of Morropon, region of Piura, the north coast of Peru.

The activity that Juana is developing is the sale of chicha de jora (traditional corn liquor) and beer. She also raises small farm animals. Her husband is a farmer. She asks for the loan to invest in a restaurant business, since she sells the drinks that she makes at home, she also wants to attend to her public with snacks like seafood, fried pork rinds, kebobs, among others. What will allow her to provide her clients with a better quality and variety of products, will increase her income and in this way her earnings will grow, and in this manner the quality of life for her and her husband will also improve.

loans.use: to invest in a restaurant business (serving seafood, fried pork rinds, kebobs, etc.).

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.en: Ugiloy is young and hardworking woman. She is 26 years old. Ugiloy began her own animal husbandry business more than 10 years. She lives in the mountain region. Ugiloy began her business with one cow. Little by little she developed the business. She feeds cows for some months and sells them in a local market. She has regular customers. Ugiloy uses the profits of her business to provide her family with all necessary things. She also made the circumcision ceremony of her son. She is going increase working capital and in this way to maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mutah

texts.en:
Mutah appreciates his previous loan. For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. The major challenge that he currently faces is the high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Máximo Israel

texts.es:
El Joven Máximo Israel habita en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades comerciales.  

Máximo Israel es un ciudadano de 51 años de edad con deseo de llegar a mejorar las condiciones de su vida, cuenta con dos hijo bajo su cargo, su esposa es ama de casa, el desempeña el cargo de técnico, en uno de los centro de salud del estado, con lo poco que el gana quiere mejorar las condiciones de su viviendita para que sus dos hijo que tanto ama vivan en mejores condiciones.

Con su salario solo se le podrán cumplir sus deseo a través de un préstamo de kiva y ceprodel, porque para él le mejoran las condiciones de su vivienda y pudiendo pagar su crédito con cuotas mensuales de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago.

Para estos solicita un crédito a Kiva y Ceprodel para la compra de: Cemento, Arena y ladrillos, con esto podrá mejorar las paredes de su vivienda. 

Viendo que la familia va creciendo poco a poco para él es de gran necesidad mejorarle las condiciones de vida. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado, y espera en dios seguir recibiendo este tipo de privilegio.
texts.en:
The young Máximo Israel lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón,department of León, a city where the inhabitants work in diverse commercial activities. 

Máximo Israel is a citizen of 51 years of age with the desire to arrive at improving the conditions of his life. He's responsible for two children under his care; his wife is a housewife. He performs the post of technician in one of the state health centers. With the little that he ears he wants to improve the conditions of his house for his two children who he loves very much so that they can live in better conditions.

With his salary he can only fulfill this desire through a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel because for him, the conditions of his home will improve, allowing him to pay his loan with monthly fees in agreement with his ability to pay. 

For this he asks for a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel for the purchase of cement, sand, and bricks. With this he can improve the walls of his home. 

Seeing that his family is growing little by little, there's a great need to improve the living conditions. 

He's grateful for the support that Ceprodel and Kiva have provided, and he hopes in God to continue receiving this type of privilege.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks

loans.name: Clara Rosa

texts.es:
Clara Rosa tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Chachapoyas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Chachapoyas, ubicada en la Selva norte del Perú.

Clara Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, los alimenta con granos naturales de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y aves de corral para poder surtir su negocio para tener una mayor variedad de animales que ofrecer a su público consumidor y así poder ofrecerlos a un mayor precio, lo que hará que sus ganancias aumenten y por consecuente su caldiad de vida mejores.
texts.en:
Clara Rosa is 59 years old and lives in the District of Chachapoyas. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Chachapoyas Province, which is part of the region of Chachapoyas in the northern jungles of Peru. 

Clara Rosa raises and sells small animals in an area behind her home. The animals feed off of natural grains that are produced in the area. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,200 PEN so that she can buy piglets and poultry to have a better variety of animals to offer her clients and to offer them at a higher price. This will increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and poultry to have a better variety of animals to offer her clients

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines and has been in this business for 14 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling coconut. 

Jonna successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonna is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar de 31 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, es una persona acompañada convive con su esposa y su hijo de dos años de edad,  su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería por falta de oportunidades en el área laboral se ha dedicado completamente a lo que le enseño su padre.

Oscar se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa  que le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. Oscar se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas que alquila  durante la mañana y por la tarde ordeña unas vacas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar dos  vacas que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche que ocupa para la elaboración de queso, crema que ofrece su esposa en su domicilio a los vecinos y en los al rededores.

 Oscar planea con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de lácteos,  la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de las vacas; podrá comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales y poder sembrar sin alquilar.
texts.en:
Oscar, 31 years old, only went to school up to the third grade. He is partnered, and lives with his wife and 2-year-old child. His father taught him how to work in agriculture and raising livestock, due to the lack of opportunities in the work area. He has worked with full effort with what his father taught him.  

Oscar gets up at 5:00 am with his spouse who supports him in his agricultural and animal husbandry. Oscar works on the plots that he rents during the mornings, and in the afternoons, he milks the cows. 

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase 2 cows that he needs to increase the production of milk that they undertake to make cheese, cream, cream that he gives to his wife in the hours, and neighbors and the surrounding area.  

Oscar plans that with the income that he gets from selling dairy products, and planting and the loan to purchase cows, he will be able to purchase a plot of land to feed his animals, and will be able to plant without paying rent.

loans.use: to purchase two cows that he needs in order to increase his milk production that he uses to make cheese and cream.

loans.name: Mirtha Aurora

texts.es:
El crear una nueva camisa, un vestido o un pantalón, son las prendas que Mirtha de 48 años, crea en su propio negocio de taller industrial de costura, el cual con tan solo un año de haberse iniciado, ya cuenta con un excelente grupo de clientes. Es madre soltera de tres hijos de 18, 25 y 17 años de edad, quienes siempre la han ayudado a realizar sus sueños, pero solo está a cargo del más pequeño. A los 14 años encontró su vocación trabajando como costurera para unas personas. Al terminar su secundaria decidió trabajar al cien por ciento en ello. Poco a poco fue ahorrando, hasta comprar sus propias máquinas e iniciar con su propio negocio. Solo cuenta con la pensión alimenticia de su hijo menor, la cual es utilizada para sus gastos académicos. 
Mirtha sueña con ver a sus tres hijos realizados profesionalmente y dejarles una casa digna, sin embargo, las paredes de zinc que rodean la letrina no concuerdan con ese plan de vida. Por lo que necesita de un préstamo para construir sus servicios higiénicos como deben ser, permitiéndole mejorar su calidad de vida. Sus planes son dar a conocer sus productos en Matagalpa y Ocotal, además de comprar un local más amplio para trabajar, pero primero quiere invertir lo necesario para mejorar su casa y hacer un cuatro más.
texts.en:
A new shirt, a dress or pants is the clothing that Mirtha, 48, makes in her own business of an industrial tailoring shop which, just a year after opening it, already has an excellent customer base. She is a single mother of three children, ages 18, 25 and 17 years old, who always have helped her realize her dreams. But she is only still caring for the youngest one.  At the age of 14, she found her vocation working as a tailor for some people. When she finished secondary school, she decided to work one hundred percent in that. Little by little, she saved up, until she bought her own machines and started her own business. She only has the child support for her younger child, which is used for his school costs.

Mirtha dreams of seeing her three children become professionals and give them a dignified house, however, the zinc walls that enclose the latrine don't fit this life plan. For this reason, she needs a loan to build a bathroom in the way it should be, allowing her to improve her quality of life. Her plans are to get her products known in Matagalpa and Ocotal, as well as purchasing a larger space to work, but first she wants to invest what is needed to improve her house and make another room.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: José Osbaldo

texts.es:
José  de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, sus padres no pudieron darle un mayor estudio por falta de recursos económicos, se dedica a la agricultura, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad su familia esta formada por dos hijos y su esposa quienes viven con él.  


José  se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos y por la tarde trabaja como motorista en un vehículo y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar veneno, semilla, abono, etc. cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha.

José  planea en un futuro  comprar un vehículo y con los ingresos de la siembra y con ayuda de otro crédito y  sus hijos espera mejorar su futuro y el de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 42 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. His parents couldn't give him more education due to a lack of economic resources. He works in agriculture, and grew up with his parents who taught him this line of work. His family is made up of two children and his wife who live with him.   

José gets up at 5:00 am to go to the plots where he works during the morning with his children and in the afternoons he works as a driver in a vehicle and his wife takes care of the domestic tasks. 

The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo is to purchase pesticide, seeds, fertilizer, etc. He has some years of the needed experience to get a good harvest.

José plans, in the future, to purchase a vehicle and with the income from the crops and with the help of another loan, and his children, he hopes to improve his future and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, seeds, fertilizer, etc. He has some years of the necessary experience to get a good harvest.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and four of her children go to school. She operates a beauty salon from the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 11 years. She takes care of additional family members. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 900,000 to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, rollers and treatments. Her major challenge is electricity blackouts that hinder her work. Her goal and aspirations is to get more hair dryers to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, shampoo and rollers

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old and married with nine children, five of whom are in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Elena has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 26-year-old homemaker. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child.  Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges from his shop.

Shabana's husband is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase both his net income and his savings. However, the lack of money makes it difficult for him to do so. Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a greater variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price.

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for reselling

loans.name: Kyeganywa Farmers' Group

texts.en: Tadeo is a member of Kyeganywa Farmers' Group, where the members guarantee each other. He has 5 children and lives in Fort Portal Uganda. He is facing the challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. Aside from this, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Tadeo needs a loan to  buy inputs like pesticides and fertilisers.

loans.use: to buy inputs like pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business, Virginia requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional linen, tailoring chalk, measuring tape, etc.

With your help, Virginia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional linen, tailoring chalk, measuring tape, etc.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Charlita has been in this business for 30 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

Charlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 46 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse is a construction worker. She is also raising hogs for income. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to invest in her business. She will buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustenance. It will help maintain good growth and nutrition for her hogs. Someday, with a good income, she will be able to save funds for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy an overlock sewing machine and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery by machine at home for the past few years to support her family. In fact, her husband is also doing the same work at home but earns an insufficient income to support family. To help her husband in his tasks related to embroidery; she sells embroidered dresses in her town. By now, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become expert in embroidery by machine and wants more raw materials for embroidery so that she can easily cope with the increasing demand for her art. 

She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of revenue to provide a quality education to her children.

Rehana thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Agnes has a restaurant business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Agnes requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, etc to restart her business activities.

Agnes has been in this business for years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en: Manolita is 55 years old from Sindangan.  For the past years, she busied herself managing her farming activities. This is how she supports her family. Manolita is requesting a loan to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and 5 liters of chemicals for growing rice and corn. In the future, she hopes to purchase more farmland to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and chemicals for growing rice and corn

loans.name: Rene Rose

texts.en:
Rene Rose relies on income from her hog-raising business. She is 43 years old, is married and has a child. Her spouse is a tricyle driver. 

She needs sustenance for her hogs; that is why she is now asking for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy feed. She hopes this loan will be given to her, as additional revolving capital will improve her income as well. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack appreciates the previous loan that helped him expand his business. 

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables to local customers. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 32 years old. She is married to Njuguna, and together they have been blessed with two children. Francisca sells secondhand clothes, in addition to having a salon. She has been in these businesses for six years now, earning a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

Francisca has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which she will use to to buy bales of secondhand clothes to resell. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, having successfully repaid her previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Francisca will be able to take care of her family's basic needs. She hopes and dreams to have a stable business that will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 50 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jeana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jeana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and married, with seven children, four of whom are in school. Susana works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.

Susana has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past four years, she has operated a retail business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With this 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su conyuge, en casa familiar en el caserio de Caserio Popan Bajo; en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; él vive en un lugar muy tranquilo donde la vida es muy aromoniosa, y la mayoría de la población se dedica a la agrícultura y crianza de ganado.

Oswaldo se dedica a las actividad de servicio de transporte(mototaxi) con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, él presta este servicio en los alrededores de su comunidad, y solicita préstamo para el arreglo de su mototaxi, pues de esta forma él asegurará el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, la que le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela; lo que por consecuente le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 48 years old. He lives with his wife in the family home in the small village of Caserio Popan Vajo, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, north coast of Peru. He lives in a very peaceful place where life is very harmonious, and most of the population engages in farming and livestock. 

Oswaldo works in the transport service (motorcycle taxi) and has more than 3 years experience in the business. He provides this service in the surrounding areas of the community. He is asking for a loan in order to service his motorcycle taxi so that he can ensure that his tool for making a living is functioning properly, so that he can provide better service to his customers, thereby permitting him to increase his earnings and improve his profits and his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle taxi in order to ensure that his tool for making a living in functioning properly

loans.name: Neris Yaneth

texts.es: Neris es madre soltera vive en casa propia  con sus hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y honrada, desde hace vario años posee una tienda y una tortillería en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Neris solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos para su tienda como jabón, gaseosas, golosinas, aceite, azúcar, etc. y para su tortillería necesita comprar maíz por quintales y así obtener mejores ingresos para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Neris is a single mother who lives in her own home with her children. She is a hardworking and honest person. For several years she has owned a store and a tortilla cafe in her place of residence. With what she earns from sales she can meet the household expenses and necessities.

Neris is asking for a loan to buy more products for her store such as soap, soda, candy, oil, sugar, etc., and for her tortilla cafe she needs to buy corn by the quintal in order to obtain better income so she can give her children a better quality of life without limitations.

loans.use: to buy soap, soda, candy, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ermer

texts.es: Ermer, Tiene la edad de 34 años, esta casado , vive su esposa la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hecer la compra de equipo para la compra de herraminetas para trabajar en la contrucción de casas principalmente, con la compra de de este equipo le facilitará la mejor contruución de trabajos y los podra realizar con una mayor eficiencia y de una calidad adecuada. Con estas herramientas y el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y la práctica podra tener un mercado mas amplio y cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR.Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayor facilidades y la tasa de interés mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ermer, 34, is married and his wife is his greatest priority.   With his loan, he intends to buy a set of tools in order to work in house construction principally.  With the purchase of this set, it will facilitate the best construction jobs and he will be able the realize them with the greatest efficiency and with adequate quality.  With these tools and the knowledge acquired in trainings and practice, he will be able to have a greater market and fulfill the demand of the customers.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not previously had other loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with great facility and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools for construction.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo  y accesorios para el cabello, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, María solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y así poder surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos y  poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter. She works selling cosmetics, body cream, shampoo and hair accessories. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay for the necessities and expenses of her household. María  is requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale and be able to stock her store to make more revenue and be able to provide her family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, body cream, shampoo and hair accessories wholesale.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia; domiciliado en una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Marcelino se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalero; hace 30 años, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo(construcción)pues desea comprar adobe, calamina y lo que haga falta para construir un dormitorio más en su domicilio, para darle mayor comodidad a su familia y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 45 years old and has a life partner. He has a child under his care. He lives in his own home residing in a rural area located in the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, north coast of Perú.

Marcelino has been working as a day laborer for 30 years. He is asking for a loan to invest in a fixed asset (construction) as he wants to buy adobe, calamine, and what he needs in order to build an extra bedroom for his home, so he can give greater comfort to his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a fixed asset (construction of a bedroom in his home).

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es:
Joel de 50 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de poder estudiar sus padres no pudieron darle estudio, se dedica a la agricultura, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad;  su familia esta formada por tres hijos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias que realiza para llevar el sustento a la familia.

Joel se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde cuida sus animales.

 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Para cultivar maíz y tener al final de la cosecha parte de su alimentación.
 
 Joel planea en un futuro tener comprar más ganado y generar producción de leche con ayuda de otro crédito y con la ayuda de sus hijos y de las ganancias obtenidas tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Joel is 50 years old. He didn't have a chance to go to school because his parents weren't able to give him an education. He works in agriculture and while he was growing up his parents taught him this activity. His family is made up of three children and his wife, who help him with his daily activities he does to support the family.  

Joel gets up at 5:00 a.m. to go to his land where he works during the morning with his children. His wife does the housework and in the afternoon cares for the animals.  
 
The loan he is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc. to grow corn and have a harvest at the end to eat. 
 
In the future, Joel plans on buying more cattle and generating milk production with the help of another loan and with the help of his children so that with the profits he can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc., to grow corn and have the harvest at the end to eat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds to plant trees

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el es un hombre responsable y trabajador, posee un tienda en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Jaime solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos para su tienda como: jabón, jugos, papel higiénico, azúcar, detergente,golosinas, granos basicos, etc. y así obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jaime, 41, lives in his own house with his life partner.  He is a responsible and hard-working man.  He owns a shop in his residence through which he earns enough from his sales to cover the necessities that come up in his home.  Jaime requests a loan in order to buy more products for his shop such as soap, juices, toilet paper, sugar, detergent, candy, basic grains, etc. and in this way obtain a greater income in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soap, juices, toilet paper, sugar, detergent, candy, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Nelly Idania

texts.es: Nelly, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en un sector que pertenece a Cofradía, municipio de San Pedro Sula.  Ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias para mujer, niño  y hombre, útiles escolares y cosméticos.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 1 año establecido en  su casa. Trabajó por varios años en una maquila como operaria y de sus ahorros decidió poner su propio negocio.  El  préstamo que ha decidido solicitar es por  6,000 lempiras el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa de mujer, hombres y niños.  Con esta inversión espera incrementar su negocio y crecer personalmente como microempresaria. Su meta es ampliar la vivienda y construir un cerco.
texts.en: Nelly is 29 years old. She is a single mother. She has a daughter and lives in an area of Cofradía, municipality of San Pedro Sula. She works selling women's children's and men's sandals, school supplies and cosmetics. She has had this business set up in her house for a year. She worked for several years in a factory as an operator and from her savings she decided to open her own business. The loan she has decided to ask for is for  6,000 lempiras. She is going to invest it in buying women's men's, and children's clothing. With this investment, she hopes to grow her business and grow personally as a micro-businesswoman. Her goal is to add on to her house and build a wall.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is from the village of Sindangan. She owns and operates a sari-sari store. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Angeles is requesting a new loan to buy groceries like biscuits, candies, soft drinks, etc. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries like biscuits, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne  is a married man with four kids, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.
