Jumanne  operates a vegetable-selling stall; he sells vegetables and fruit at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 



With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to pay school fees and buy vegetables and fruit for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hens and broiler chickens.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is the age of 40, and the mother of two children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he has installed a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories; he hires laborers for the molding machines for daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories, he needs a different type and quality of raw material. 

This time he has taken a bigger contract than previously, but does not have enough to buy an additional molding machine and the raw materials to continue his manufacturing. 

Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy crushing plastic raw material for manufacturing. 

She is very happy after receiving this loan, and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy crushing raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional food to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for two years now.

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional food to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old and has four children.  She is married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his son's school fees.

loans.name: Sarah Al-Matar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sarah Al-Matar. It consists of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They asked  for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB. 

Nadia is a 31-year-old widow, living in her own house which is uncompleted. She is the leader of the group. She works as a cleaner in the streets with a small salary, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband passed away several years ago. When he was alive, he and Nadia shared in accumulating an amount of money and built their own house on the land they purchased. That building cost them a lot of money. 

Nadia's husband passed away before completing the building of the house. Now the house is not renovated from the inside and most of the rooms are without doors and windows. Nadia decided to go ahead and complete the renovation of the house and purchase doors and windows for the rooms. That work needs a lot of money. Unfortunately; Nadia's salary is not enough. For this reason, Nadia is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase doors and windows to renovate the house.

Nadia looks forward to building a second floor in order to rent it out to earn money to help her cover all the expenses of the home.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows to renovate her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 30-years-old. She is married to John and together they have been blessed with one child who is 5-years-old. John provides additional income for the family.

Christine runs a beauty salon, a business she has done for the last 6 years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000.

Christine has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase a blow dryer and hair products (hair relaxers, shampoos, conditioners and hair oils) as well as hair extensions.

With the anticipated profits, Christine will be able to open a wholesale shop where she sells hair products and hair extensions.

Her hopes and dreams for the future include having stable finances for the family as well as recordable growth in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a blow dryer and hair products

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa, decicado al cultivo de café, su vivienda se encuentra ubicado el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Nelson se dedica al cultivo de café, hace ya 10 años; él solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para su cultivo y para invertir en rl mantenimiento de su finca, ya que manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores y mejores rendimientos de producción,loq ue le permitirá vender su producto a un mejor precios, generandole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Nelson, 45, lives with his wife.  He makes a living growing coffee.  His residence is located in the District of Callacyuc, Province and Region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.
For ten years already, Nelson has been making a living growing coffee.  He is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer for his crop and to invest in the maintenance of his farm. By keeping up his farms, he will obtain greater and better production yields, which will allow him to sell his product at better prices, generating a greater income, better profits, and ultimately a better quality of life for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop and to invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eliodora works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Eliodora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Eliodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and a daughter. Her husband owns a small gemstone shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case to attract customers.  

He has only one source of income, but he alone has to cover the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children, and household expenses. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living in.

Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can increase the inventory on a daily basis and increase his earnings as well. She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members can spend their lives comfortably.

Asia is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy gemstones for resale

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PARIS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de telas, alquiler de vajillas, venta de regalos, atención de salón de belleza, venta de chocolates, venta de artículos de ferretería, servicio de lavado de autos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelly es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de alquiler de vajillas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace dos años iniciando con el servicio de decoración de flores en los salones, ya con un poco de capital acumulado ella decide implementar este negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de compra de vajillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Paris is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board with Nelly as the President. The business that the members of the communal bank have are varied and among them are: food sales, fabric sales, tableware rentals, gift shops, beauty salon, chocolate sales, hardware sales, and car washing.

The loan they are taking out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs where Nelly is a member. She says that it is the first time that she has partnered with Pro Mujer,  joining through an invitation from a counselor who visited her home. Currently she has a tableware renting business. She tells us that she learned this business two years ago beginning with flower decoration of living rooms, and established the business with a little accumulated capital.

The loan that she is taking out now is for an increase of capital (to buy tableware at wholesale) which she will buy from the wholesalers of the city of LaPaz and later she will add it to her service area. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she lives with a life partner.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy tableware at wholesale price

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of said co-op. 

In need of additional working capital, Lita requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income so that she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is happy she can support the education of her children, which is the main reason for her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hollow block making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional loads of sand, gravels and cement for her business for her hollow block making business.

Esther has been in this business for 5 years. Esther earns more income from a general store.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional loads of sand, gravels and cement for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 43 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children who are now school age.

For her source of living, Marigen has been engaged in managing a little eatery business for 20 years already and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional stock of meat, dressed chicken, rice, spices, seasonings and vegetables for her eatery business.

Marigen has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her eatery business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of meat, dressed chicken, rice, spices, seasonings and vegetables.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is thirty years old, married and has three young children. For the past seven years she has worked making pancit, or thin Filipino noodles. She earns approximately 30,000 PHP each month doing so.

Leonor has been a member of PMPC for a year. She has requested a 50,000 PHP loan to be used to buy additional flour, salt, oil and seasonings for her pancit business. She hopes to see her business continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, oil and seasonings for her pancit business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 62 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, who are now adults.

To earn a living, Carmen is engaged in managing a sari-sari store, where she sells groceries and other consumer goods. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from her business activities.

She has requested this loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods for retail purposes. Carmen has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Carmen hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchasing additional inventory of groceries and other goods

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
This is Ludivina, 51, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and she is happily managing her own business while also helping her family financially. She works hard to provide for her needs and not to become a burden to anyone.

Ludivina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products.

Ludivina hopes to have her own restaurant and dreams of having better living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 32-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good and she has to think many times to start any task. Now her husband newly started to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not enough strong to bear jerks over the roads. 

The rickshaw body needs to be replace because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for the moto rickshaw. Therefore, Kiran has requested a loan so that her husband can maintain the rickshaw body so that he can drive rickshaw smoothly. 

Kiran thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 25-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child. She is doing embroidery work by her hands at home and financially supporting her family.

She belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor, therefore she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has learned these arts in her childhood, now she adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and earn a sufficient income. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stock of threads, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

Kiran hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery work

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a veterinary products sales business in the Philippines. Gloria has been in this business for 2 years. Gloria earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of veterinary products to sell for her business. She explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47-years-old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando's previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to buy more quantities of raw materials such as paint, screens and shirts. Aside from this, he was also able to send his children to school.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP. He will use the new loan to buy additional materials and supplies needed in his silkscreen printing business. His profits from business will definitely help sustain his daily needs and provide for his children’s education. He looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Rolando still hopes to expand his business and put up another branch. He dreams for his family to be always sufficient in everything. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of raw materials such as paint, screens, and shirts.

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es: María tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 años y 20 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora quien con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo van sacando adelante a su familia.  María desea terminar de construir un cuarto el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillo, etc. y poder así finalizar el cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 44 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, ages 18 and 20 years old. María is an entrepreneurial woman who, along with her husband and with great effort, is moving her family forward. María wants to finish construction on a room, which for the lack of financial resources has not been finished. For this reason, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, steel, bricks, etc. and be able to finish the room as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, steel, bricks, etc. to finish building a room.

loans.name: Cesar Armando

texts.es: Cesar tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su madre y sus dos hijos de 12 años y 4 años de edad. Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace 11 años. Cesar es un hombre visionario quien se preocupa por dar mejores condiciones a su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una fosa séptica para la cual necesita comprar materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, etc.
texts.en: Cesar is 35 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife, his mother-in-law, and his two children, ages 12 and 14 years old. Cesar is a very hard working man has made his living providing security services for the past 11 years. Cesar is a visionary man who is always concerned with providing better living conditions for his family. With the desire to improve the conditions of his home, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a septic tank, for which he will need to purchase materials such as cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc. to build a septic tank

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to fully utilize the loan to purchase more vehicles and motorcycles needed in his buy and sell business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for additional vehicles and motorcycles. More items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Eduardo aspires to have his own shop and to continue the smooth operation of his business. He dreams of a simple life and sufficiency in everything, especially for the education of his children and grandchildren. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vehicles and motorcycles needed for his buy and sell business.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed supplies and materials for her garden business. Her income from the business is assisting her everyday household needs and paying bills. She continues to work to provide for her everyday needs. She also sells frozen foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hermosa dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gardening materials such as wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shawki

texts.en:
Shawki is a 31-year-old single man, living with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He studied until secondary school, but he couldn't complete his studies.

To earn a living, for many years he has been engaged in the business of selling stationary materials, such as pens, rulers, books, notebooks, and similar kinds of goods. He started his business with a small amount of financial support from his parents. As a result, Shawki is very thankful for his parents and their financial support, which changed his life. His business is located near a school in the capital city of Sana'a. The school has a lot of students, who attend different classes. His profits from his business are solid.

To further expand his business, he applied for a loan in the amount of 199,900 YER from Kiva partner AMB. He will use the loan proceeds to expand and improve his business by purchasing a variety of stationary materials. Shawki looks forward to expanding his business more in the future to be able to meet all of the demands of the local students. He explains that he is a very active and ambitious man.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing additional inventory of stationary materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella posee un bazar ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que tiene y por los buenos precios, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos como recuerdos, bolsas de regalos, listones, agujas, hilos, etc. para surtir aun mas su negocio y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This client lives in her own home with her husband and daughter.  She has a variety shop located in the market near her residence.  She has a large clientele due to the variety of products and good prices she offers.  With what she earns from her sales, the client is able to meet the expenses that arise in her home.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more products, like souvenirs, gift bags, ribbons, needles, thread etc.  With these items, she will be able to stock up her business even more and, along with her family, enjoy improved financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs, gift bags, ribbons, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Eunises

texts.es: Antonio de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de pollos de engorde para su comercialización, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, Antonio solicita un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para su alimentación y así seguir con la crianza para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Antonio, who is 35-years old, lives in his own home with his wife.  He has made his living for a number of years raising and selling broiler chickens.  With what he earns from his sales, Antonio is able to meet the expenses that come up.  Antonio is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens, and animal feed for them, so that he can keep raising them and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Agé de 41 ans, marié et père de cinq(5) enfants  Amavi habite à Avépozo. Il exerce le commerce comme activité génératrice de revenu depuis 1999. Il avait commencé avec la vente des ciments  et  il y a 12 ans, il fait la vente des produits d’alimentation générale et de charbon de bois. Amavi  s’approvisionne 4 fois par mois au grand de lomé et revend dans une boutique à son domicile. Amavi sollicite un microcrédit pour agrandir son stock afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Amavi is 41 years old, married and the father of five children. He lives in Avepozo. He has been working as a vendor since 1999. He first started  by selling cement, and 12 years ago he launched selling basic food items and charcoal. Amavi stocks up four times a month at the big [market] of Lomé and resells out of a store set up in his home. Amavi is seeking a microloan in order to increase his stock and earn a bigger revenue.

loans.use: to buy one bag of charcoal, one bag of corn and four cartons of tomato paste.

loans.name: Alma Stella

texts.es: Alma vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, desde hace varios años posee una tortillería ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, el negocio es bastante conocido por sus clientes, tiene varios clientes que la visitan diariamente, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Alma solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal  para su negocio y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alma lives with her family in her own home.  For a number of years, she has had a tortilla shop located in her residence.  The business is quite well-known among her customers, and she has a number of customers who come on a daily basis.  With what Alma earns from her sales, she is able to meet the household needs and expenses.  Alma is requesting a loan to purchase lime and wholesale corn for her business.  She will then be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lime and wholesale corn.

loans.name: Georgina  Xiomara

texts.es: Georgina tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser muy visionaria, responsable y sobre todo trabajadora. Ella labora en una maquila como operaría desde hace 2 años, lo cual le permite llevar el  sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de la familia. Geogina solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc. para construir tres paredes y cerrar el corredor de su vivida y así poder habilitar un cuarto. Espera poder constar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Georgina is 21 years old and lives in her own home along with her partner and her 3-year-old son. She is a visionary, responsible, and, above all, hardworking woman. She has worked in a factory as an operator for the past two years, which permits her to support her family. Together with her partner, she maintains the family finances.

Georgina is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, etc. in order to build three walls and close off the corredor of her home to make another room. She hopes she can count on this financing and this way, give her family a better living situation.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, etc. in order to build three walls in the hallway to make another room.

loans.name: Elba Roxana

texts.es: Elba de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades y los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Elba solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos para su tienda como gaseosas, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, etc. para surtir su tienda y así poder darle a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 48 year old Elba lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter. She has a small store located in her place of residence. With what she earns from her sales she is able to cover the necessities and the expenses that come up in her home. Elba is requesting this loan to buy more products for her store, like sodas, oil, sugar, candy, etc. to supply her store and this way be able to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sodas, oil, sugar, candy, etc.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 45 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta sexto grado y esta acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres.

Marisol se levanta junto a su esposo a las 5:30 a.m  para realizar sus actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y el cuido del ganado solo su hijo es quien viven con ellos.

Marisol se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en las parcelas que posee, oficio que realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo. En el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y a vender la leche entre sus vecinos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar la semilla, abono,veneno, etc. Que necesita para sembrar maíz y llegar a obtener una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is forty-five years old.  She completed her studies up to the sixth grade and is in a relationship.  Her partner in life makes a living in agriculture, a business he learned from his parents.

Marisol wakes up with her husband at 5:30am to perform her daily activities that center on agriculture and the care of cattle.  Only their son lives with them.

Marisol makes a living working in agriculture on the plots of land that she possesses, work that she realizes during the morning together with her husband.  In the course of the afternoon they work milking cows and selling the milk to their neighbors.

The loan she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc., that she needs to plant corn and obtain a good harvest to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc., that she needs to plant corn and obtain a good harvest to support her family.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOWARA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame DJAMATIO débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women averaging 50 years of age, with eight children. They live mainly in traditional families in Lobowara, a village in the township of Lobougoula in the district of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow peanuts, which is what Mrs. Djamatio does, for example. She is the second one standing from left to right in the group photo.

With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg [110 lbs] bags of fertilizers and two jugs of herbicide as well as pay the cost of labor to work 0.5 ha [1.2 acres} of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce in her village and in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit.
She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 74,000 francs per agricultural cycle.
This revenue will allow her to repay her loan with interest and help her husband with everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, herbicides, and the cost of labor.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOWARA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame ALIMA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “BENKADI 2” are married women, who average 48 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in LOBOWARA, a village in Commune de LOBOUGOULA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. ALIMA (standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 2). With her loan, she intends to purchase two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and plowing

loans.name: Wend La Boumbou Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ISSAKA représente le groupe WEND LA BOUMBOU. Il se porte bien. Marié, il est maintenant  père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 03mois. 03 vont à l’école(02 de ses enfants et 01 autre enfant dont il s'occupe) et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Il est couturier depuis 12ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de son secteur.
Mr veut s’acheter une douzaine de fermeture, une douzaine de bouton et des tissus popelines.
IL  veut épargner ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne agrandir son atelier de couture  et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. ISSAKA represents the group WEND LA BOUMBOU. He is doing fine as far as his health. He is a married father of three children. The oldest is 9 years old, and the youngest is 3 months old. Three go to school. (Two are his own children, and one is under his care.). He has four persons to support. 

Mr. ISSAKA has been a tailor for twelve years. He gets his supplies from a market in his sector. He wants to purchase a dozen zippers, a dozen buttons, and some poplin cloth. He wants to save his profits to bolster his business. His ambition is to expand his tailoring workshop and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dozen zippers, a dozen buttons, and some poplin cloth

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, is aged 41, married to a motorcycle driver and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 11 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on school allowances for their children. Due to insufficient funds she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, beverages, & noodles for her retail store. She's hoping that her business will continue to expand and improve so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, beverages, & noodles for her retail store.

loans.name: Jeneve

texts.en:
Jeneve is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jeneve hopes that her store will further improve and that her profit will increase more so that she could continue to attend to the needs of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 57 años de edad, y logro sacar un bachillerato. Hoy en día se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Él se creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, su familia esta con formada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos, ya que sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte.

Oscar se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en otras parcelas.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, veneno, abono, rastreo de la tierra, etc. Para sembrar maíz y espera le produzca una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.

 Oscar planea en un futuro incursionar en sembrar chile y tomate y con ayuda de otro crédito espera lograrlo con el involucramiento de su esposa podrá comprar vacas y producir leche y obtener un ingreso adicional para su familia
texts.en:
Oscar, who is 57-years old and graduated from high school.   Today, he makes his living farming and raising livestock.  Oscar was raised by his parents, who taught him these trades. Oscar's family is made up of his wife, who helps him with the household chores, as their children live apart, in their own homes. 

Oscar gets up at 4:30a.m. to go to work.  He works his rented parcel of land in the morning, and during the rest of the day he work on his other plots of land. 
 
The loan Oscar is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for the purchase of seeds, poison and compost and to plow the land etc. so he can plant corn.  He hopes for a good harvest so he can feed his family. 

Oscar plans, in the future, to try out planting chilies and tomatoes.  With the help of another loan, he hopes to involve his wife in purchasing dairy cows as another source of income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, poison and compost and to plow the land etc. so he can plan corn and hopefully have a good harvest to feed his family.

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 58 ans, Rita est mère et  a en charge cinq(5) enfants dans le quartier d’Avépozo. Elle fait le commerce comme activité avec  l’achat et  vente  de pain. Rita  s’approvisionne tous les jours  chez le boulanger du quartier  et revend par la vente ambulante dans les environs de son quartier. Rita  sollicite un  prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Married and 58 years old, Rita is the mother of five children to support in the Avépozo district. Her business involves commerce in bread. She gets her supplies each day from bakers in the district and resells them by hawking around her district. Rita is requesting a loan to expand her business in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase various types of bread

loans.name: Estrellitas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DEL MAR” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de awayos, confección de chompas, venta de habas por mayor, venta de bisutería, tienda de barrio, servicio de construcción.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de habas por mayor; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia conjuntamente su esposo, hace tres años atrás, ya que este producto tiene recepción en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra habas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The comunal bank “Estrellas del Mar” will begin its third loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It is made up of eight members and it is directed by an executive board of which Juana is the president. 

The businesses that the association’s members carry out are varied, and include selling  cosmetics, woven textiles, making sweaters, selling broad beans in bulk, selling costume jewelry, a neighborhood shop, and construction services.  

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small businesses and business holders which Juana is also a part of. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for two years. She got in by an invitation made by a promoter of the institution that visited her at her home. 

Nowadays, she has a business selling broad beans in bulk. She says she started it along with her husband three years ago, since this product is well received by the market.

The loan is to buy food in times of drought (buy broad beans in bulk) that she will purchase from the wholesalers of her community. Then she will commercialize with it at her sales place. 

This type of work allows her to generate incomes to support her family, since she lives in common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she says that she liked the life insurance that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy broad beans in bulk.

loans.name: Eva Consuelo

texts.es:
Eva Consuelo tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una comunidad habitada por personas respetuosas y honradas, la cual es una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Eva Consuelo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, ella cría a su animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio; Eva solicita préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprando un mayor número de animales, tales como cuyes, patos, gallinas, pavos; para asi tener una variedad más grande que ofrecerle a sus clientes, lo que le va a permitir ser mucho más conicida en el negocio, podrá captar a más a clientes, aumentarán sus ingresos, al igual que sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida tambien mejorará.
texts.en:
Eva Consuelo is 44 years old, lives with her husband and has a son under her care. She lives in her own home in a community inhabited by respectful and honorable people, which is in a rural zone in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, along the north coast of Perú. 
Eva Consuelo earns a living raising and selling farm animals. She raises her animals behind her home. Eva requests this loan to invest in her business by buying a greater number of animals, such as guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and turkeys; this way she can have a greater variety to offer to her customers, which will allow her to become better known in the market, and will allow her to get more customers, increase her income and likewise her profits, and therefore increase her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals, like guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and turkeys, to have a bigger variety to offer her clients.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis, tiene 43 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive actualmente con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Gualala, Santa Barbara. Tiene su propio negocio que es una pulpería y también un molino de moler maíz. Este negocio lo tiene hace 6 años en su casa y le apoya su esposa e hijos. Además tiene un cultivo de café.  Vende  productos comestibles como  refrescos, churros, galletas, pan, lácteos, carnes frijol, azúcar arroz etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para invertir, en la compra de productos como ser granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, golosinas, refrescos, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes.  El préstamo le  ayudara  a tener variedad de productos y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir ampliando el negocio.
texts.en: Luis, who is 43-years old, is married and has two children.  He currently lives with his family in a neighborhood of Gualala, Santa Barbara.  Luis has his own business, a small grocery store.  He also has a mill for grinding corn.  He has had his grocery for six years, and it is located in his home.  His wife and children help him with the business.  In addition, he has a coffee crop.  In his store, Luis sells foodstuffs like sodas, churros, crackers, bread, dairy products, meat, beans, sugar, rice etc.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 lempiras (USD $950) to invest in the purchase of products for his store, like basic grains, meat, dairy products, sweets, sodas, cleaning supplies and other groceries.  The loan will help him to have a variety of products in his store and increase his sales.  Luis's goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to stock up his business with foodstuffs like basic grains, meats, dairy products, sweets, sodas, cleaning supplies and other grocery items.

loans.name: Abdulslam

texts.en:
Abdulslam is a very clever and dynamic man. Last year he took out a 150,000 YER loan through AMB to buy construction materials to build a house. He successfully repaid this loan and has now applied for another loan of 300,000 YER to buy iron, steel, cement, bricks, etc. to complete the second floor of his house.

Abdulslam warmly thanks Kiva lenders for financing his first loan which allowed him to build the first floor of his house. He now hopes to obtain this loan in order to build the second floor. He is waiting for your financial support in order to begin construction. He is a very grateful and thankful man.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build the second floor of his house.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso is a hardworking and smart woman. She is thirty years old, divorced and raising an eleven-year-old daughter.

Up until four years ago Nuriniso worked selling glasses. Since then she has worked sewing both traditional and European-style dresses for the local community. She works six days a week in her own workshop located in the town’s marketplace.

Nuriniso is applying for a 4,000 TJS loan through IMON International to buy a new sewing machine because her old one is broken. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ramón Atilio

texts.es:
Ramón de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, se dedica a la agricultura, creció con sus abuelos quienes le enseñaron esta actividad; su familia esta formada por su esposa quien le ayudan en las actividades diarias que realiza para llevar el sustento a la familia.

 Ramón se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus 2 hijos que le colaboran y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde trabaja como cuidandero de una finca cerca de donde reside.

 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Para cultivar maíz. 

 Ramón planea en un futuro comprar ganado y generar producción de leche con ayuda de otro crédito y con la ayuda de sus hijos y de las ganancias obtenidas construir una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
59 year old Ramón went to school until fourth grade, earns a living in agriculture, and was raised by his grandparents who taught him to farm. His family is made up of his wife who helps with the daily activities that sustain the family.
Ramón gets up at 5:00 a.m. to go to the parcels of land where he works in the morning alongside his two children that help contribute and his wife dedicates herself to domestic service. In the afternoon Ramón works as a caretaker at a ranch near his home. 
The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO, is to buy poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc. to grow corn. 
Ramón plans in the future to buy cattle and start producing milk with the help of another loan and with the help from his children and his obtained profits to build a worthy home.

loans.use: to buy poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc. to grow corn.

loans.name: Nahi

texts.en:
Nahi is a 30-year-old single man who has been working in selling and maintaining computers and laptops. Nahi is the sole earner in his family; he is responsible for the living of three more members. In 2008, Nahi opened his own computer and laptop maintenance and sales shop after he was an employee for four years in a similar company  in order to increase his income and develop his family's living.

Nahi is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy extra laptops to trade with, in addition to necessary hardware to make his maintenance services move faster.

He is working hard to open a lager shop in the future on the main road so that he can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy extra laptops to trade with, in addition to necessary hardware to make his maintenance services move faster.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado de su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a la venta de mariscos, comercializa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios, con lo gana de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Agustín solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mariscos por mayor y así poder darle a  su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Agustín, who is 55 years old, lives in his own house with his family group, which consists of his wife and their children. He sells seafood. He sells it as a street vendor in the different neighborhoods that are located near his house. He has many customers because of the quality [of the seafood] and his good prices. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some of the expenses that arise in his household. Agustín is applying for a loan to purchase more seafood wholesale and thus be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more seafood wholesale

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: Muhayo was born in 1972. She lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan. She is a very industrious woman. Muhayo is a careful mother of six children. Her husband is a builder. Muhayo is an entrepreneur. She sews national women's dresses in her house and sells them in a local market. She has begun this business with a sewing machine, which she was given by her mother. For three years, she has been busy with this business. Muhayo is going to increase her working capital and in this way, offer more dresses to local people. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy fabrics. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 31 years. He is married and together with his wife they have been blessed with three children of 10, 8 and 6 years of age.

Stephen is a farmer, a business he has done for one year now, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Stephen has requested 20,000 KES for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. With the profits from the business, Stephen will be able to repay his loan as well as expand his business further.

Stephen's hopes and dreams are to diversify into large scale farming as well as to educate his children for life.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a married man and a father of four living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He  deals in transporting,  moving people and goods from rural to urban areas. He also earns additional income by selling general merchandise in a retail shop along a busy street. He began the business to supplement his income from the transport business, as he is faced with a hardship of poor roads, which become impassable during the rainy season. Benson hopes to buy a bigger car with this loan to improve his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a car for transport

loans.name: Nichita

texts.en:
Nichita, 56, is a widow and the mother of several children. She operates a food stall where she sells fish and squid balls plus other street foods. She is thankful for a previous loan offered her through CCT, as she was able to buy extra food to sell. Her earnings were a big help in covering one of her children’s tuition and other everyday expenditures.

Nichita is now applying for another loan, this for 14,000 PHP to be used to buy more of the raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will continue to be applied toward the same ends.

Nichita wishes to see her youngest child complete their college degree and dreams of her business ever improving. She looks forward to an increase in profits with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more of the raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes es el caso de don Juan de 56 años de edad que está solicitando otro préstamo para sembrar papas ya que si deja buena ganancia par su familia.
	
Cuando no tenía acceso a los préstamos en ADICLA  él  tenía poca cosecha de papas ya que no tenía recursos económico para poder cosechar mas de sus  productos, el nuevo préstamo que el está realizando es para la compra de fertilizantes para tener más cosechas de papas para tener mejores ingresos económicos para el y su familia.

Los prestamos que a hecho con anterioridad le ha ayudado mucho con los ganancias que ha obtenido y los ha invertido en su vivienda para mejorarla, uno de los sueños de don Juan es el cultivo de 12 cuerdas de papas y para la construcción de su casa para tener esas condiciones de vida que el a querido para su familia durante muchos años.
texts.en:
Agriculture is an activity that is appropriate only for all those people who love the land like a mother, like a generator of futures for life. Good futures of hopes for following generations is the case for Don Juan, who is 56 years old and is applying for another loan in order to plant potatoes, since this gives good earnings for his family.

When he didn't have access to the loans in ADICLA, he had little harvest of potatoes, since he didn't have the economic resources to be able to harvest more of his products. The new loan that he is taking out is to purchase fertilizers in order to have more harvests of potatoes and have better economic income for him and his family.

The loans that he has had beforehand have helped him a lot with the earnings that he has obtained, and he has invested them in his house to improve it. One of Don Juan's dreams is the cultivation of 12 plots of potatoes and for the construction of his house in order to have those living conditions that he has wanted for his family for many years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Khadija Al- Hodiedah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Khadija Al- Hodiedah. It consists of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They asked a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. 

Alia is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 15 years old, and the youngest nine. Alia is an uneducated but very vigorous woman. One day, her husband was very ill. At that time, he was the sole breadwinner for the children. His income stopped and he didn't have money to purchase medicines for himself. Alia didn't ask people for help to purchase the necessary medicines for her husband, but decided to work selling makeup, perfumes and accessories door to door to purchase the medicines for her husband. She earned a good amount of money in that time, and people helped her very much through purchasing all her goods. Then she decided to go ahead in her business. For further expanding her business, Alia requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area.

Alia looks forward to expanding her business by opening a small store to sell accessories, makeup and ready-made women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup and cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a married man and a father of six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a banana farmer and a cattle trader, buying and selling cattle in various markets in the rural and urban areas of his district. He began the business to earn school fees for his children, but he is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital to improve on the quality of his cattle in his farm and to buy more for selling. Vicent is requesting a loan to purchase more cows to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is married and blessed with four kids, all of whom attend school. The family lives in their own house, which has electricity and piped water. Doreen's greatest monthly expenses are food and medical expenses. 

Doreen operates a clothing business, selling women's and gents' suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators as her major challenge. 

With the 45,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo, reside son su familia en el municipio de El Progreso, Yoro. Se dedica a la venta de accesorios para su celular, focos, radios y otros,  desde  hace 3 años y esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos. Este negocio lo realiza en el mercado local de la zona y ofrece  todo tipo de accesorios como  cargadores, manos libres, cables, memorias, cobertores, focos, radios, etc. El  préstamo que solicita es de 10,000 lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de accesorios de celulares como cargadores, cobertores, cables, memorias, chips, focos, radios etc.  Para poder seguir con las ventas. Su plan a futuro es lograr tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Manuel is 23 years old. He lives in free union with his partner, with whom he has a son. He lives with his family in the township of El Progresso, Yoro. For three years he has been selling accessories for cellular phones, light bulbs, radios, and other items, and this activity is his only source of income. He carries out his business in the local market in his zone, and he offers all types of accessories such as chargers, hands-free units, cables, memories, covers, light bulbs, radios, etc. The loan that he is applying for is for 10,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of cellular accessories such as chargers, covers, cables, memories, chips, light bulbs, radios, etc., to be able to continue with his sales. His plan for the future is to manage to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories such as chargers, covers, cables, memories, and chips, light bulbs, and radios to sell

loans.name: Srey Cheat

texts.en:
Srey Cheat, pictured here, is 21 years old and single. She lives with her parents, sister and brother in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Srey Cheat is now a second year student in an accounting institute in Phnom Penh, majoring in Accounting. She hopes to continue her studies, which is why she applied for a loan in order to pay for her school fees. 

In the future, Srey Cheat wants to become an accountant for a microfinance institution or bank!

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for five years, and she repaid her previous loan. She also finds ways to improve her income by managing and maintaining a piggery, which also helps to provide her family's everyday needs.

Lucia would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle and also to buy more pigs and feed needed in her piggery. She is requesting 50,000 PHP for the specific needs of her businesses. Lucia is shown in the photo with her piggery.

In the future, Lucia hopes to increase her profit and further improve her businesses. She only desires good health and a sufficient living for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Rukiidi 111 Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Margret is a member of Rukiidi 111 Tweyimukye group where each member guarantees each other. She is 57 years old and has four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in running a butchery business, the business she started with a vision of generating income. She faces the challenges of inadequate capital and competition. However, she hopes to expand her business to new areas and educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Margret needs a loan to buy goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a married male with 12 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. As a family man, he works hard to have a good standard of living and see all his children attain a basic education by growing cocoa for sale. He wishes to have good machines to dry his cocoa and construct a permanent house for his children but limited funds affect his progress. Elias is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cleaning products for her store

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y dos hermanos de 17 años y 10 años de edad. Francisco trabaja en una panadería cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Francisco solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar el techo de la vivienda y además desea comprar puertas para los cuartos dormitorios. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y dos puertas. De esta forma espera poder brindar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Francisco is 22 years old and resides in his own home along with his mother and his two siblings, ages 17 and 10. He works at a bakery near his town, which allows him to help his family with the household expenses.

Francisco is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that he can improve the roof of his home. He also wants to buy doors for the bedrooms. The amount he is requesting will be used to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and two doors. This will provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his home and to install doors for the bedrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water, juices, and sodas in bulk, as well as another cooler.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: María, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Ella trabajó por unos años en una maquila y luego decidió poner una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser carnes, lácteos, arroz, frijoles, harina, churros, refrescos, pan, huevos, condimentos, productos de aseo etc. lo tiene hace 8 años y ha sido rentable. Ha obtenido varios préstamos para mantener el negocio estable, actualmente solicita otro por 6,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio de productos comestibles como granos básicos, productos de aseo, carnes, verduras, manteca, arroz y otros, para darle mejor atención a los clientes. Su plan es crecer en el negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. They have three children and reside in a neighborhood within the town of Choloma, Cortes. María worked for a few years at a factory, but later decided to open a store where she now sells basic household products such as meat, dairy goods, rice, beans, flour, snack foods, soft drinks, bread, eggs, condiments, cleaning products, and other items. She has been in business for eight years and her venture has been profitable.

María has obtained several loans in order to keep her business stable. She is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 6,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with food products such as basic grains, meats, vegetables, lard, rice, as well as cleaning products and other merchandise. This will enable her to provide better service to her customers.

Her plans include growing her business and making improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, lard, rice, as well as cleaning products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes de 45 años de edad vive con esposo, sus hijos y nietos en casa propia tiene muchos años elaborando forros para almohadas, comercializa de forma ambulante en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, con lo que gana de las ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Diomedes solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales como: telas de colores, hilos,etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diomedes is 45 years old and resides in her own home along her husband, children, and grandchildren. For many years she has been making pillowcases and selling them as a street vendor in the areas surrounding the neighborhood where she lives. With the earnings from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household necessities.

Diomedes is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as fabric in different colors, thread, and other items. As a result, she can continue her work so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric in different colors, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Arlen Vanessa

texts.es:
Arlen es madre soltera con un  pequeño hijo a su cargo al que le brinda su apoyo para su desarrollo, y trabaja para la junta de fomento, desempeñándose como operadora de Bascula desde hace 4 años y de profesión  Lic.  Administración de Empresas.
Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y lo utilizaría para gastos personales,  el que le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida  en su hogar
texts.en:
Arlen is a single mother with a young child under her care, so she must provide for his development. She has been working for the Development Board as a scale operator for the past four years. Arlen has a degree in Business Administration.

She came to the CEPRODEL office in order to request loan, which she will use for personal expenses. This will help to improve her conditions and the standard of living at home.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Bella

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 27 ans, Bella est mère de deux(02) enfants dans le quartier d’Avépozo. Elle fait le commerce comme activité avec  l’achat et  vente  des friperies et des produits de beauté. Bella  s’approvisionne deux(02) fois  par mois au marché d’Akodessewa et au grand marché de lomé et revend sous un hangar à son domicile. Bella  sollicite un prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
27-year-old Bella is the married mother of two children and lives in the Avépozo neighborhood. She has a business buying and selling used clothes and beauty products.

Bella resupplies twice a month at the Akodessewa market and the main market in Lomé, and resells under a shed at her home. Bella is requesting a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 4 dozen dresses, 8 dozen skirts and 18 dozen bras

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a married man with 8 children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man, dealing in cattle trade as his main source of income and based in the rural area. He has been in the business for ten years and gets additional income from farming. 

Sunday began the business in order to generate income to educate his children, and now he would like to enter into other markets in the urban centres to expand his business and get more income. The main challenge he faces is that of price fluctuations. 

With this loan, Sunday intends to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 33-year-old single woman living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Her main business is in cattle trade, buying and selling cattle in the rural area of Kyenjojo. She gets other income from dairy products like ghee, butter and milk. She began her business to look after her elderly parents and to be self-reliant, but her challenge is limited capital. She hopes to complete her personal house. Jovia is requesting the loan to complete her personal house.

loans.use: to complete her personal house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother). She and her family live in a rented house and have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Grace has a restaurant business, and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken and charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken and charcoal.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is married with three children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He gets his income from boda boda, a common name for a motorcycle transport business, with a monthly salary as additional income. He hopes to build a residential home, but mainly faces a challenge of bad weather, especially during the rainy season, which makes transport difficult. He needs the loan to diversify his income to buy maize products to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize products to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a posho mill maize grinding machine business for over five years; she operates at the market where neighbors are the potential customers. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bags of maize for sale. She dreams of expanding her business by purchasing another grinding machine in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for sale

loans.name: Senaida

texts.en:
Senaida is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit.
