Her profits from the business will definitely help to cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Senaida hopes that she will become a more successful and prosperous entrepreneur through all her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Hanou

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 51 ans, Hanou est mère et  a  un enfant  en charge dans le quartier d’Avépozo. Elle fait le commerce comme activité avec  l’achat et  vente  des sachets plastiques. Hanou  s’approvisionne trois(3) fois  par mois au grand marché de lomé et revend par  la vente ambulante les environs de son quartier. Hanou  sollicite un prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
51-year-old Hanukkah is a mother with one child under her care, and lives in the Avépozo area. Her business activity is buying and selling plastic bags.

Hanou resupplies three times a month at the main market in Lomé and resells as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood.

Hanukkah is seeking a loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy different kinds of plastic bags

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is the age of 34; she is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To cover the rickshaw repairing cost

loans.name: Al- Ameara Group

texts.en:
Al- Ameara is a group which comprises four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Amira is the leader of the group. She is a 26-year-old single woman. She has three sisters and six brothers, and is living with her family in their own house. She is an elementary student. Amira's father has a taxi and works on it as a driver. He also has two rented apartments inside his building. He is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

Amira is a very active and dynamic young woman. She wants to help her father with the expenses of her family, and she has a great motivation to learn the sewing. She thinks the sewing business is a suitable business for her. Unfortunately, the income of her father is not enough to purchase all the sewing materials for her. As a result, Amira applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a sewing machine and many sewing materials, such as threads, buttons, and some kinds of stylish women's fabrics to start in sewing.

Amira looks forward to providing her family with all of the home appliances. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and many sewing materials, such as threads, buttons, and some kinds of stylish women's fabrics to start in sewing.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with no children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past two years, she has been operating a business selling cereals, and she sells from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Lilian dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.en:
Ranojon is 44 years old and is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her life partner is a photographer, and they are bringing up  2 daughters. They live together in North Tajikistan.
 
She is one of the successful business women in the local market, and she has been selling perfumes for over 10 years. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills have helped her to develop her business, and in this way to improve their living conditions. Her daughter helps her with the business. 

Ranojon wants to develop her business further, but as her income is small she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy more perfumes to increase her working capital. This is her second loan from IMON and she has good credit history. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy perfumes in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario lives in Masindi-Uganda, he has got a butcher shop that sells meat so as to earn income to cater for his family's needs. He also owns rentals where he gets more income. He desires to educate his children, even though he complains of inadequate capital and customers who take meat on credit and fail to pay on time.

Mario will use the loan to buy cows.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a cafe business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase to food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Al- Hayat* Group

texts.en:
Al- Hayat* is a group which comprises of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Afaf is the leader of the group. She is a 23-year-old single woman. She has two sisters and seven brothers, living with her family in their own house. She is an elementary student. Afaf's father is a bus driver. He is the sole breadwinner of the house. Afaf is very clever young woman. Her house lacks of a washing machine. The income of her father is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family and to purchase home appliances. She decided to help him in improve the living standards of the house. Unfortunately; she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Afaf applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a washing machine for her house. 

Afaf looks forward to providing her family with all of home appliances and furniture to make her house very comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine for her house

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOWARA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame MARIAMA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who on average are 45 years old with five children, and live for the most part in traditional families in Lobowara, a village in the municipality of Lobougoula, which is part of the Sikasso Circle in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Mariama, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the photo of this Benkadi 3 group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and pay for plowing to cultivate 0,5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. She expects an average profit of 74,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, herbicides, pay for plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOWARA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame TOUNTOUKO débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women who on average are 42 years old with six children, and live for the most part in traditional families in Lobowara, a village in the municipality of Lobougoula, which is part of the Sikasso Circle in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Tountouko, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Benkadi 4 group of women. 

She intends to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and pay for plowing to cultivate 0,5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. She expects an average profit of 74,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Chiện works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Chiện is 59 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Chiện is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group, which consists of four members. 

This is Chiện's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Chiện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Chiện hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking mother of four children and the wife of Makau. Makau provides additional income for his family.

Jane is a farmer. This has been her livelihood for the last six years, earning her a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Jane has requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting, as well as pay her laborers.

Jane will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hope and dream for the future is to be a wholesale dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting, as well as pay her laborers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 20-year-old man with two children. His main income is from the motorcycle (boda boda) transport business that he started in order to sustain his family. He generates other income from agricultural produce. He hopes to buy many motorcycles to hire out to other people for more income. He is hardworking, though he faces the challenge of poor roads that lead to constant repairs due to breakdowns. Peter needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of 40,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 33-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. Her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets to manufacture iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. So that he can generate more income for his family, Samina is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's shuttering work. Samina is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shuttering work

loans.name: Yiri Nafa Kabo Group

texts.fr: Yiri nafa kabo est un groupement de producteur d'anacarde de Sindou à l'ouest du burkina Faso. ces producteurs travaillent avec ACFIME depuis 2012 et prennent des prêt de 09 mois à échéance unique vu que l'activité est saisonnière. Ils ont toujours été à jours de leur remboursement. Yacouba est le responsable du groupe. Grâce à ce crédit, il pourra entretenir son verger d'anacarde, il ferra aussi appel aux associations villageoises pour l'aider dans le sarclage, le chauffage, la taille de formation et de l’étalage des arbres.A la fin de la saison et après la vente, le bénéfice lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille et de continuer ses activités.
texts.en:
“Yiri nafa kabo” is a cashew-producing group of Sindou, in western Burkina Faso. These producers have been working with ACFIME since 2012 and take out nine-month single-payment loans, given that the work is seasonal. The producers have always been on time with their repayment.  

Yacouba is the group’s official. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to maintain his cashew tree orchard. He will also call upon the village associations to help with the weeding, [heating or firing], trimming, and display of the trees. At the end of the season and after the selling, the profit will enable him to take care of his family and to continue his business.

loans.use: to maintain his cashew tree orchard

loans.name: Rodema

texts.en:
This is Rodema, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Joey, an operator and she is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rodema oversees and owns a tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Rodema dreams of having another tricycle to use in their business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Al- Zohour** Group

texts.en:
Al- Zohour** is a group which is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Hanadi is the leader of the group. She is a 20-year-old single woman. She has one sister and six brothers, and she lives with her family in their own house. She studied till the secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Hanadi's father has a taxi and works on it as a driver in order to earn money to improve the living conditions of his family. That money which he receives from the work with his taxi is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Hanadi wants to help her father to cover some of the needs of the house. Her house lacks a refrigerator, and she can't afford one. Inside the kitchen of her house, Hanadi has many kinds of drinks and sweets which need to be in a cold condition particularly the climate is very hot these days. Unfortunately she doesn't have a refrigerator in order to keep the drinks and food cold. As a result, most of those foods and drinks expire quickly. So she ends up putting them in the litter bin. 

For this reason, Hanadi is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition in the house. Hanadi looks forward to improving the living conditions of her family.  She hopes to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition in the house.

loans.name: Jose Odilio

texts.es: José tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 19 años y 13 años de edad. José trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y mantener la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del servicio sanitario dado que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder terminar el servicio sanitario lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children aged 19 and 13, in a house of their own. He has been working as a mason for a long time, which helps him to sustain her family and cover the home expenses.

José went to FUSAI with the aim to improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel and other materials to build a bathroom, something he has not been able to do due to the lack of money. He hopes to receive this loan in order to build the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel and other materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOWARA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame FATOUMATA S assises à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The six members of Benkadi 5 Group are married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of five children and mostly live in traditional families in Lobowara, one of the villages in the commune of Lobouboula, in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Fatoumata, sitting at the far right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg bags of fertilizer, two canisters of herbicide and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and interest, as well as help her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicide, and labor costs.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOWARA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame OUARABA debout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma signed up for her membership with PMPC to avail herself of the needed capital to start her sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. Norma is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc. In the future, she hopes to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia runs a tailoring business and made good use of a previous loan to buy the materials she needs to do her work. She has been in this line of work for years, and shares her responsibilities with her husband.

She is requesting a new loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional supplies such as fabric, cloth and thread. The profits she earns from this loan will help her meet her daily needs. She is grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders.

Deogracia only desires to be always healthy and fit for work even at her age. She hopes to have more customers and increase her profit so that she could continue to help support her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Djebeleton  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJEBELETON 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TAMARO, un des villages de la commune de DAH cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’ arachide  avec MINATA ABOU,  2ème femme assise de la gauche vers  la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à DAH, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 48 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of Djebeleton 1 Group are married women with an average age of 35. They have an average of three children and all live in traditional families in Tamaro, one of the villages in the commune of Dah, in the area of San, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Minata Abou, sitting second from left to right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and small farm equipment and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining of 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in Dah, to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn an average profit of 48,000 FCFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, as well as help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, inputs, small farm equipment, and seeds.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.fr:
Desiré fait partie du groupe  Business et  habite à Bujumbura.C’est un célibataire de 29 ans . 

Il fait le commerce de chaussures  depuis  7 ans. 

Il est son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle .
texts.en: Desiré is a member of the Business Group. He is single, 29 years old, and lives in Bujumbura.  He has been selling shoes for seven years. He is on his sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy more shoes to resell to earn more income.  In the next few years, he would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a lot of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Arise Group

texts.en:
The Arise Group is made up of three ladies who work in the sale of groceries, foodstuffs, drinks, and smoked fish. The group is composed of women who, despite their low educational level, have managed to be part of the loan system for over five years and to acquire solid experience in the system. 

Mawuena (standing on the far left) is the representative of the group. She is 37, married, and the mother of two children. She sells smoked fish that she buys from big distributors to resell in the market in town. 

Mawuena's new loan will allow her to buy baskets of smoked fish for GHS 2,000 for resale. The profit will permit her to share in covering the needs of her family on the one hand, and to grow her savings on the other. Together with her friends, Mawuena's group will need a total amount of GHS 4600 to expand their businesses and they will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy baskets of smoked fish for GHS 2,000 for resale.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
Da is a young and dynamic woman who was born in 1983. She lives in a small village of the Dong Anh district. Da has two daughters, both of whom are still young. Her husband is a worker and she is a tailor. Her family income is about VND 8,000,000. Her challenge in life is a shortage of capital to expand her business. 

Da has been a loyal participant of SEDA’s program since 2007. She successfully repaid a loan of VND 11,118,000, and the current loan cycle is her seventh. This time, Da would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to buy clothes for her tailor shop. She wishes to improve her family’s living standards and create good conditions for her children to go to school. 

Da is also the leader of a group that includes six other SEDA members, who are included in the following list:
1. Xay is a young and dynamic woman who is 30 years old. She is requesting a loan of VND 12,426,000 to run a grocery business.
2. Mai is 52 years old. She would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to feed pigs. 
3. Huong is 34 years old. She is the mother of two children. She is applying a 9,810,000 VND loan to run a grocery business.
4. Thom is 30 years old.  She has two children. She is requesting a loan of VND 9,810,000 to run a food stall. 
5. Truong is 57 years old. He has three children. He is requesting a loan of VND 12,426,000 to purchase supplies for his food stall. 
6. Hoa is a 50-year-old-woman. She has two children. She would like to borrow VND 5,014,000 to plant trees.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her tailor shop

loans.name: Nimrongo

texts.en:
Nimrongo is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Nimrongo operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 20 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in her business. Nimrongo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Nimrongo wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has one child, who attends school. Eunice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Eunice operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition in her business from other charcoal sellers.
 
With this KES 20,000 loan, Eunice wants to purchase bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Miledi

texts.en:
Miledi is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband Mikheil in a small village in the Kaspi district. Mikheil is a constructor worker and gets a small monthly income.

Miledi is unemployed and decided to start her business. She requested a loan from the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a cow. She will start producing dairy products to sell. This will give her a chance to have her own income. Miledi will expand the husbandry business in future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products

loans.name: Margaritas De 15 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITA DE 15 DE JULIO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de calzados, venta de tucumanas y rellenos, venta de zapatillas deportivas, confección de faldas, venta de chicharron de cerdo, venta de ropa, venta de jugos y batidos, servicio de tintado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de faldas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa de su madre y de ella ya que ambas ingresaron a capacitarse en un centro de formación técnica. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MARGARITA DE 15 DE JULIO” communal bank will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Santiago II center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Julia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling shoes, selling tucumanas and rellenos, selling tennis shoes, making skirts, selling pork chicharron, selling clothes, selling juices and smoothies,  and a dyeing service. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Julia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago. She joined at the invitation of a sister in law who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business sewing skirts. She says that she started this business on her own and her mother's initiative. Both of them took trainings at a technical training center.  
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital by buying fabric wholesale. She will acquire it from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and after production will sell her skirts in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her sister. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bales of used clothes and doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes from Japan and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando de 55 años de edad, desde hace 10 años,  se dedica a la producción de calzado, en su pequeño taller donde trabaja con su esposa y dos empleados más. Las líneas que ofrece Orlando están dirigidas a damas, caballeros y niños, pero muy especialmente trabaja el calzado para hombres. Orlando sale semanalmente, con sus muestras actualizadas, rumbo  a los almacenes del centro de la ciudad  y a establecimientos en el municipio de Baranoa, pueblo cercano a Barranquilla. Su meta más adelante es lograr una producción de calzado deportivo, para en un futuro comprar la vivienda donde habita con su familia, el cual es su máximo sueño. El mayor desafío de Orlando,  es conseguir trabajadores especializados en modelos deportivos,  para aumentar su producción. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará capelladas, suelas, adornos, pegantes e insumos para proveerse y finalmente llegar a sus metas.
texts.en:
Orlando, 55, has been making shoes for ten years in a small workshop, where he works with his wife and two employees. He makes shoes for women and children, but mostly for men. Every week, he visits different shops in the city center and takes with him the latest designs. He also visits the municipality of Baranoa, which is close to Barranquilla. His goal is to start making sport shoes in order to be able to buy the house where he now lives with his family, which is his biggest dream. The toughest challenge that Orlando faces is to find skilled workers that can make sport shoes, in order to increase his production.

Orlando is now requesting a CrediKiva, which would be the first loan he receives from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy toecaps, soles, accessories, glue and other supplies he needs in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy toecaps, soles, accessories, glue and other supplies to make shoes.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is 34 years old, widowed, and has two children. She owns a bookstore, which is based in the local market. Here, she offers all school supplies, college notebooks, lined notebooks, double-lined notebooks, pens, and staplers. Matluba also sells hair supplies. She has been busy with this business for more than 11 years. Her daughter helps her with managing the business. This business is the main source of income for the family.

To improve her business, Matluba is borrowing 5,000 Somoni from Imon International to buy school supplies. She is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: To buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a boutique business and has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes, and she doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Syokau

texts.en:
Syokau is a married woman with three school-going children. She and her family live in their own house, which has electricity and piped water. Syokau's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Syokau has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed and there is a low turn out of customers. 

With this KES 40,000 loan, Syokau wants to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies, facial kits, relaxing chemicals and shampoo, and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loan requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies, facial kits, relaxing chemicals and shampoo, and hair food

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

Janet operates a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have big water storage tank in the near future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale.

loans.name: Najmat Baghdad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Najmat Baghdad. It consists of four women members from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Aziza is a 40-year-old married woman, with only one 14-year-old child, who is living with her family in a rented house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. She is a university graduate. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. In time he became unable to look after the family. Aziza wanted to share with him that responsibility, so she decided to work as a beautician and from that business she earns good profits.

Her house lacks many home appliances, and most of them are very old. In reality the profits from her business are good but not enough to purchase new home appliances for the house. The washing machine inside the house doesn't work well because it is very old. As a result, Aziza wants to change it and purchase a new one. For this reason, Aziza is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new washing machine to replace the old one.

Aziza looks forward to providing her house with all of the home appliances.  She hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own house on it.

loans.use: to purchase a new washing machine to replace the old one

loans.name: Om Ecram** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Ecram**. It consists of four women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 7 years old, and the youngest one is 3 years old. She lives with her family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future. 

Fatima works as a tailor inside her house, and her husband is an employee in the public sector. They share the responsibility of covering the family expenses. 

Their house lacks a power generator. Unfortunately, the country has to deal with many crises. One of these crises is the electricity power cuts. Many people live in darkness most nights around the country. The electricity crisis has become one of the biggest problems in Yemen, especially after the 2011 revolution. For this reason, Fatima applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a power generator for the house in order to have good light at night.

Fatima looks forward to improving the living standards of her family through the purchase of home appliances for the house.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator for the house in order to have light.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children. Two children go to school. 

She sells chips at the market in the evening on retail basis. She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last five years. Nulu works for seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cabbages, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a deep fryer to make better chips. 

Nulu lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cabbages, and cooking oil

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Agnes sells bread, milk, and Blue Band margarine at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for one year.  She works seven days a week. 

Agnes has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy loaves of bread, packets of milk, and a box of Blue Band. Her major business challenges include defaulters and high taxes. Agnes aspires to increase her sales so as to increase her capital base. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy loaves of bread, packets of milk, and Blue Band margarine

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 34 years old. She is married to Joel, and together, they have been blessed with four children aged 18, 14, 11, and 7 years old.

She is in the food and charcoal business which she has done for the last one year. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES.

Angelica has requested her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to stock vegetables as well as sacks of charcoal for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to stock vegetables as well as sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman aged 50 years. She has six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Constance operates a fruit and vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and blessed with two children who both attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. She sells at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation for her business. Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business and establishing a rental house in the near future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase prawns and dried fish for resale. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust because of their favorable loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Mussrat

texts.en: Mussrat is a 48-year-old married mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she initiated her business selling milk. She has 5 calves and 2 cows to milk. She has been doing this job for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She is hopeful to get increase in her sales and profits along with them.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and feed for calves.

loans.name: Djebeleton  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJEBELETON 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TAMARO, un des villages de la commune de DAH cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’ arachide  avec  SALI LAMINE,  1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à DAH, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 22 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djebeleton 2 group are married women with an average age of 44 years and an average of 3 children each. They all live in traditional families in Tamaro, one of the villages in the Dah community of San, in the 4th administrative region of Mali.

The women partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their 4th loan with the organization, with their previous loans having been fully repaid.

Sali Lamine, pictured as the first woman seated on the right in the photo, is in the peanut farming business. With her loan she plans on purchasing supplies, seeds, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor necessary to maintain 1 hectare.

Sail Lamine sells her crops at the village level and in Dah after her harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average income of 22,500 francs CFA at the end of the season. This income will allow Sali Lamine to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase labor, supplies, seeds, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children. Two children go to school. 

She sells fresh fish at the market on a retail basis. She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works for seven days a week.

Sylivia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy fish. Her major challenges include ever increasing prices of fish and seasonality. 

She aspires to buy a plot of land and also start selling dried fish. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expense includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children. Two children go to school. 

She sells fried cassava and chips at the market on a retail basis. She serves all kinds of people and has been in this business for the last 10 years. Grace gets additional income from farming and poultry. She works for seven days a week. 

Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bag of cassava, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cassava, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Duhoze Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure  fait partie du groupe  Duhoze et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Seconde,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants ,âgés de 3 à 22 ans, dont 6 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de vaches et chèvres depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  chèvres, à revendre pour gagner plus. 


Dans les prochaines  années il voudrait associer l'agriculture à son commerce et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is a member of the Duhoze group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Seconde, a farmer. Together they have 8 children between the ages of 3 and 22, 6 of whom attend school.

Bonaventure has been in the business of raising cows and goats for 3 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, Bonaventure will increase his capital and purchase many goats, in order to resell them and increase his earnings.

In the coming years, Bonaventure would like to add farming to his business and to provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase many goats, in order to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell to her customers

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Sugran is 57 years old and runs a small general store very close to her house. She has been handling this store for the past two years with the assistance of her son. Her shop is situated in the middle of her town, and a sufficiently large number of customers visit it every day. She is doing quite well and has a number of repeat customers. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle and has successfully repaid her previous loans on time. Now, she has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR with which she intends to purchase a stock of soaps, shampoos, hair oils, toothpastes, and edibles. 

Sugran dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of soaps, shampoos, hair oils, toothpastes, and edibles.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 49-year-old married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals like baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then, sells them at the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

At present, she has two goats. Shamim also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. Shamim is very experienced and has good contacts at the market. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 50-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth. She buys cloth of different fabrics and various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates. She then sells the cloth to the people of her community. 

Naseem has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 42-year-old married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals like baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then, sells them at the market at higher prices. At present, she has four goats.

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. Naseem also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts at the market. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Al- Maha Al- Hutheli Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Maha Al-Hutheli. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is a hardworking woman. She is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest one is only one year old. Fatima lives with her family in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is the leader of this group. Her husband has a taxi and works as a driver. The income from his business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. In order to help him with the expenses of the family, Fatima decided to work in dressmaking and selling ready-made women's clothes. She started her business with a small amount of capital more than five years ago. Her business lacks some materials for sewing and her capital is still low. For this reason, Fatima applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials such as as fabrics, threads, buttons, and other materials in order to improve her business. Fatima looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a dressmaking store.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons, and other materials in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a very strong, hardworking, 72-year-old widow. She currently supports her three children of 22, 20 and 18 years of age.


Alice is a farmer. This has been her source of livelihood for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.


Alice has requested 20,000 KES for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use it to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting. With the anticipated profits, Alice will be able to cater for her children's needs.


Alice's hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop which will secure her finances and family's needs even during her absence.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Juliet sells fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years and she works seven days a week. 

Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy fish. Her major challenges include the ever-increasing prices of fish and seasonality. Juliet aspires to buy a fridge to keep fish fresh. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical expenses. 

Esther operates a clothes selling business, selling women's and men's suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators as her major business challenges. 

With this Kshs 20,000 loan, Esther wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business

loans.name: Kalsom

texts.en: Kalsom is a 42 year old married woman. She and her husband run a business which sells vegetables. She is very enthusiastic about her business, which she has had for many years, and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. Kalsom is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. To improve her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, ginger and garlic. This loan will help her meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, ginger and garlic.

loans.name: Bikas Shg Group

texts.en:
MESP, a non-governmental organization in Deoghar District of Jharkhand, offers a combination of small loans and participatory education to women who share the common goals of eliminating poverty and empowering themselves. 

Nisha is one of these women. She is the leader of Bikas Self-Help Group, which includes four other women. She is married and has three children who all are studying in school. Her husband is involved in a decorating business, but his income is not adequate to pay for the family's expenses, so she started her tailoring business two years ago. Now there is a good demand, so she wants to improve her production. 

With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine. She wants to be certain to satisfy the desires of her clients and generate enough income to give good education to her children, which is her ultimate dream.

Along with Nisha, other group members are also requesting loans to improve their livelihoods. They are thankful to the investors for their kindness and generosity in providing capital for the loans.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Laxmi Self-Help Group consists of five women who are friends residing in the same district, Deoghar in Jharkhand. 

Mamuna, the group’s representative, is the one with a hand raised in the photo. She is 39 years old and did not attend school. She is married to Lalmohan Miyan. The couple have four children.
 
The diverse family expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Mamuna and her husband have been selling grocery items for about nine years. Their income is INR 150-200 per day. She gets her supplies from a market in Deoghar. 

One year back, her elder daughter got married, and for this marriage they spent around 4 lakh, which affected their savings. They are still trying to recover from it. 

Now she is requesting a loan to add more goods to her grocery shop in order to increase her family income. 
 
With the goal of increasing their businesses, Mamuna and the other members of the group are requesting a loan for the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to add more goods.

loans.name: Falani

texts.en:
Falani is from Tekatuli village in West Bengal. She is a hardworking mother. She is 31 years old. 

Besides spending time in cooking and looking after her husband and three daughters and other household jobs, Falani manages time to help her husband in his agricultural activities. Two of her daughters are in school; one is too young. Falani is an illiterate woman who can sign her name only.

Falani's husband, Suklal, age 44 years, is involved in agricultural work. He grows rice on his farmland and sells in his locality. He supplies good quality rice at a cheaper price, so his customers like him. In this way, he supports his two primary-school-going children, ensuring that they continue their studies. His total income is insufficient after all the hard work they put in. Now they want to increase the volume of paddy cultivation, but lack of capital is the main hindrance.

That is why Falani is asking for a loan from BJS to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary products. The loan will help her to earn an extra income to reach her goals. With the increased earnings, she will be able to plan for the basic essentials her family needs and give her children a better standard of life.

She is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Lalmani

texts.en:
Lalmani is a hardworking woman. She is 35 years old and lives in the village Mouyamari, a  remote region in Jalpaiguri district. She is illiterate but can sign her name. She is married and has two children (one son and one daughter). One of the children attends school and the other is too small for school. 

Lalmani’s husband, Dinesh, has been working hard to manage her timber business, which sells wood and timber. They have a small wood shop near their house. He started up the business using his own funds and began by purchasing wood from the wholesale market and selling to the local carpentry shops and local people. 

 They are hard-working, responsible people who are always looking to improve. As the needs and the expenses of the family are increasing day by day, they have decided to grow the business to cope up with the situation. So Lalmani is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more wood and timber for her husband's business. One of her dreams is to keep expanding in her business so that she can generate more income in the near future. She hopes her dream will be fulfilled through this loan.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more wood timbers for their existing timber business.

loans.name: Machhina

texts.en:
Machhina is a 33-year-old woman from Maynaguri. She is married to Nazrul and together they are raising three children (two sons and one daughter).  They are students in grades 7, 3 and 3.  Machhina attended school till grade 7 and her husband has a secondary education. They live at Bagnan, a small village in the district Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.

Machhina's husband is associated with a jute business. He purchases raw jute from farmers and sells it to their neighbors and in the market to those who prepare jute handicrafts items like bags, table mats, etc. He is the main source of income for the family. Machhina is a very enterprising and enthusiastic lady. She helps her husband in his business after managing her livestock and household works. 

Now Machhina and her husband want to grow their jute business as the demand for jute is increasing day by day. Thus she is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use the loan to buy more jute.

She has many plans, but her main one is to grow their business and give her children proper education. With the profit from this business she hopes to fulfill her plans.

She appreciates her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more jute for business.

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es: Henry tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su dos hijos de 5 años y 2 años de edad y una sobrina de 10 años de edad. Henry es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica a la venta de cocos y a demás presta servicios de seguridad en un rancho cerca de la playa. Henry desea reparar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pintura, lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para pintar las paredes de la vivienda y para ampliar galera de cocina. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Henry is 29 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, two children aged 5 and 2 and his 10-year-old niece. Henry is a hardworking man who sells coconuts and works as a security guard on a ranch near the beach. 

Henry wants to make repairs to his house and that is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to purchase paint, zinc-coated steel sheet, wood and nails, to paint the walls and to expand the kitchen. He hopes to have this financing and be able to begin with the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase paint, zinc-coated steel sheet, wood and nails, to paint the walls and to expand the kitchen.

loans.name: Kanbala

texts.en:
Kanbala is a hardworking widow who hails from Maynaguri. She is 28 and lost her husband at this tender age. She lives with her two young sons, who go to school. They are in grade 8 and grade 7. She lives with her sons in their own house at Ashok Pally in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has to face a lot of problems to pay the expenses of her family as well as the educational costs of her children.

To earn a living for the family, Kanbala was compelled to practice livestock. As she is illiterate, she had no other option but to rear a cow and start a milk supply and milk products business. She is a very passionate dairy farmer, whose primary source of income is based upon the sales of milk and dairy products (curd, ghee, paneer, etc.), which she makes at her home.

Kanbala is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase an additional dairy cow after assessing the persistent demand for milk products in her region. With this loan, she is going to purchase a dairy cow. Having understood the market requirements, she wants to expand her dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that she can diversify the farm’s products.

The loan will help Kanbala to increase her business and make enough money to settle her high family expenses. She thinks that the loan will benefit her family by providing her with the financial ability to improve their lifestyle and enable her to provide better education to her sons.

She is grateful to her generous lenders who extend their hands of cooperation towards her in her odd situation.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk and milk products business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge desde el año 2012,  se dedica al oficio de panadería. Él siempre ha estado involucrado en este tipo de actividad productiva, pues su familia se dedicó a ella y también obtuvo experiencia trabajando en tiendas con énfasis en panadería. Hoy junto a su padre trabaja este oficio, tienen dos empleados y ambos (él y su padre) son los encargados de la distribución en las diversas tiendas, ubicadas en diversos barrios de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Los productos principales de su oferta son los pan piñitas, pan de sal, galapas, etc. Productos que vende de contado, trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, de lunes a sábados. Su meta es la de expandir su negocio en muchos mas clientes, aumentando su producción y logrando contratar mas empleados. Porque mas adelante sueña con obtener su propia casa y necesita ahorrar de sus ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará latas para hornear, enseres para aumentar la posibilidad de incrementar su producción, especialmente en la etapa de horneo. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará porque tendrá las latas suficientes  donde colocar el pan para llevarlo al horno y que sus clientes lo lleven.
texts.en:
Jorge has been working as a baker since 2012. This activity is a family tradition, so he has always been involved in it. He gained experience by working in stores that specialize in bakery products. He is now working together with his father and two employees. He and his father are in charge of distributing their products to different stores located in different neighborhoods in the city of Barranquilla.

They sell different products, such as bread, sweet buns and galapas [stuffed buns]. He gets paid in cash and works from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm, Monday to Saturday. His goal is to expand his business and reach many more customers by increasing his production and hiring more employees. He dreams of buying a house and needs to save some of his income.

Jorge is requesting a CrediKiva, which would be the first loan he receives from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy trays and utensils needed during the baking process, looking to increase his production. With this investment, his business will improve because he will have enough trays to bake bread for his customers.

loans.use: to buy trays and utensils.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia de 18 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y el calzado a crédito desde hace 1 año. Ella orientada por su suegra, quien es comerciante de mucha experiencia, aprendió la actividad comercial, con el fin de apoyar los gastos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad.  Hoy los productos de su oferta son jeans, suéteres, camisas, calzado, colonias, y perfumería, artículos  que vende directamente a su clientela, mediante créditos que se ajustan a las cuotas que puede pagar cada cliente;  en su negocio Natalia trabaja todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su clientela fija la conforman amigos y referidos por estos, con los que ha logrado sostener su negocio. Su meta mas adelante es abrir un local al público y finalmente comprar un apartamento. Su mayor desafío es fidelizar a su clientela, para lograr el incremento de sus ventas y poder ahorrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, suéteres, camisas y calzado. Con esta inversión mejorará su negocio pues aumentará su productividad en el marco del incremento de sus ventas, lo cual es el éxito de este crédito.
texts.en: Natalia is 18 years old, and she has worked for one year selling clothing and shoes on credit. She was guided in this by her mother-in-law, who is a merchant with a lot of experience. She learned this business activity in order to help with the expenses of her household, which is made up of her husband and her little 2-year-old daughter. Currently, the products she offers are jeans, sweaters, shirts, shoes, colognes and perfumes. She sells these items directly to her customers, through credit arrangements tailored to the payments each client can afford. Natalia works every day on her business, from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. Her steady customers are friends and those referred by them, and with these customers she has been able to sustain her business. Her goal for the future is to open up a shop to sell to the public, and eventually to buy an apartment. Her greatest challenge is to keep her customers loyal, so that she can expand her sales and build up her savings. At present, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she is requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it, she will buy jeans, sweaters, shirts and shoes. With this investment, she will improve her business, since she will increase its productivity by expanding sales, and this will be the favorable result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy jeans, sweaters, shirts and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Adijha

texts.en: Adijha, 58 years old, is a single woman with eleven grandchildren living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She practices cocoa farming. After making small amounts from cocoa selling, she came up with the idea of selling cosmetics and women's wrappers in addition to owning rental houses to fetch extra income to make ends meet. She dreams of completing her rentals though limited capital and high costs of building materials affect her. She is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement and pay for labor.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement and pay for labor to construct rental houses.

loans.name: Amita

texts.en:
Amita is a 29-year-old rural woman residing at Maynaguri. She is married and a mother of two adorable daughters. She studied till grade 5 and could not continue study due to parental poverty. She, with her husband and sons, lives in a small village Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri. One of her sons goes to school, the other is too young.

Her husband, Dulal, is a cycle-van puller by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled cycle-van. He has been driving a van for many years to meet the family's expenses. It is a kind of transport that is a very popular and useful in rural West Bengal to carry loads and people to cover a short distance. He is the only source of income for the family. But of late the cycle-van has been damaged because of excess usage. Now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. So the family has no income at present. They thought over it and have decided to purchase one new cycle-van. The main challenge is capital.

For this reason, Amita has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS for her husband. She wants to buy a new cycle-van with the loan. This will help him to run the business more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

Amita is thankful to Kiva and BJS. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his services.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Sartawi Jalsuri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTAWI JALSURI” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Matilde es la Presidenta.
