Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, taller de mecánica y lacado de autos, compra ganado, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Matilde es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  lechería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar que este producto era ampliamente comercializado en su comunidad iniciando con cuatro vacas. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo dará a su ganado para que tenga una buena producción. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “SARTAWI JALSURI” will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada central office. The group consists of 9 members and is led by a Board of Directors where Matilde is the President.  The members of this communal bank engage in different businesses such as selling cheese, auto body repair and painting shop, buying livestock, and selling milk. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Matilde is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago after receiving an invitation from a member who visited her at her house. Currently she has a dairy business. She gained knowledge about this business by noticing that this product was sold widely in her community and she began with four cows. 

 The loan she will receive is to increase capital, purchasing forage at wholesale in her community which will then be given to her cattle to have a good production.   Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as she is married and has one child.  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the loan and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase forage wholesale.

loans.name: Nubuyat

texts.en:
Nubwati lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Nubwati sells fried cassava and chips at the market on a retail basis. She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last four years and she works seven days a week. 

Nubwati has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bag of cassava, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Nubwati aspires to educate her children to the university level. She would also like to acquire better serving utensils. Nubwati lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and cassava

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a very young entrepreneur from Maynaguri. She is only 28 years old and resides with her 31-year-old husband with whom they are blessed with two sons. Kalpana and her husband both passed grade 5. One of their sons is in school; the other is a toddler. They live in a small village Mouyamari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Kalpana's husband is a driver by profession. They find it is hard to depend on his income, as it depends on the availability of work. So Kalpana has been actively involved in cattle rearing. She enjoys dairy farming; milking her cows is her hobby. She supplies milk to her neighbors to generate additional income for the family. Now she wants to expand her business and satisfy the demand of her customers. But the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of business capital.

To solve this problem, Kalpana is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow. Having an additional cow will provide her with a lot of practical benefits. She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. In the short run, she will be saving the returns to send her sons to a better school. In the long run, she will have saved enough money to go for better breeds of cows. Kalpana's dream is to build her capital and asset base in order to lead a financially secure life in the future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad, se dedica a tres actividades: producción y venta de almuerzos, yogurt por litros y ponqué o tortas. Ella habita con su cónyuge  al suroccidente de la ciudad  y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 18 a 33 años. Su experiencia data desde el año 2006, cuando emprendió su pequeño negocio, aprovechando que su vecina le propuso vender alimentos en los sectores cercanos a su casa, pues muchas personas no tenían la facilidad para cocinar y atender la alimentación diaria  de su familia. Hoy ha agregado a los almuerzos productos lácteos naturales y ponqués, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana,  hasta las 3 de la tarde,  de lunes hasta sábados, comprando de contado en depósitos de víveres en la ciudad y vendiendo en las modalidades de crédito y de contado,  a sus principales clientes que son sus vecinos en el  barrio. Su meta es hacer mejoramiento del local del restaurante y también más adelante hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda, pues quiere y tiene el desafío de fidelizar a su clientela y acrecentarla. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, víveres, yogurt y ponqué, en mayor volumen,  para reducir los costos generados por las compras al detalle, obteniendo mejores descuentos, por la disponibilidad de efectivo que genera su crédito  y el aumento de su capacidad e compra. Lo que hace que su negocio mejore con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. She has three businesses, making and selling lunches, selling yogurt by the liter and selling scones or cakes. She lives with her spouse in the southwest of the city and has four children between 16 and 33 years old. Her business experience dates from 2006 when she started her small business taking advantage that a neighbor wanted to sell food in the neighborhoods close to her house. Many people don't have the facilities to cook and take care of feeding their family.

Today added to the lunches are natural dairy products and scones. She works from 6 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon, Monday through Saturday. She buys in cash at food wholesalers in the city and sells on credit or in cash to her main clients who are neighbors from her area.

Her goal is to make improvements on her restaurant and also make adaptions to her house. She has the challenge of making loyal clients andexpanding. She is applying for a loan from KIva which is her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy food, yogurt and scones in greater volume to reduce the cost of buying her supplies retail. She will get better discounts because of the cash available from the loan and increase her capacity to buy. This loan will make her business better.

loans.use: to buy food, yogurt and scones in greater volume.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida, a 56-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling her products to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

For the improvement of her business, Zahida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Zahida's sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Majidan

texts.en:
Majidan is a 44-year-old married woman. She has worked in agriculture with her husband (also shown in the picture) for the last six years. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. Her husband assists her in growing various crops by watering the soil to ensure good quality production. In this way they have earned a good profit. They are happily doing this together to support their family. They have four children, all of whom are school going. 

Majidan has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 51-year-old woman. She has been running a business trading cloth for the last three years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Azra requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of cloth for the summer season. By taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers, she would be able to earn more income through higher sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been successfully running a general store business. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

Bushra wants to increase her earnings to better support the needs of her children. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase packs of tea, oil, milk, sugar, grains, and rice. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. With a good credit history, this will be Bushra's third loan.

loans.use: to purchase packs of tea, oil, milk, sugar, grains, and rice.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is an enterprising woman of 46 years from the small village of Petkati in the district Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter) who are students of grade 9 and 6. She has an elementary education and her husband, Prasanta, attended school up to grade 9. 

Her husband is a laborer on daily wages who has no consistent income. So it is difficult for him to make ends meet. Dipali has been practicing cattle breeding for last five years to give sustenance to her family through dairy. She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable. She has a dairy cow. She supplies milk from door to door to her neighbors.

In order to increase her business she needs to purchase one more cow. But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Dipali is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers, and thus earn more. She has taken a loan from BJS. The loan will greatly help her to organize her business in more effective ways. She wants to assist her husband economically and educate her children properly to establish them.

She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She sells fruits and vegetables from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She has no additional family members. She works seven days a week and gets additional income from selling charcoal, baking, and tailoring. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, and oranges. Her major challenges include high taxes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, and oranges

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Blanca desea montar un negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas en un local ubicado cerca de su casa en el municipio de Medellín.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación de sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, esto la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Trabaja actualmente en una cafetería como cocinera, pero ahora desea independizarse y aprovechar todos los conocimientos obtenidos.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, nevera, 1 freidora, insumos como pan, queso, carne, pollo, jamón, etc., e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the hope of moving forward and overcoming her situation, Blanca wants to start a business preparing and selling fast food in a store located close to her house in the city of Medellín.  

This idea arose from her motivation to help her two children of 9 and 7 years old to get ahead. This pushed her to start this business and in this way generate the necessary earnings to support her home. 

She currently works in a cafeteria as a cook, but now she wishes to become independent and take advantage of all that she has learned.

She asks for a loan to buy all of the necessary things to build her business such as a freezer, a fridge, a fryer, ingredients like bread, cheese, beef, chicken, ham, and other ingredients needed to prepare meals.

With these things she will be able to begin this project, and will be able to achieve her dream of being independent. 

By supporting this loan, you will be encouraging the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a fridge, a fryer, and ingredients such as bread, cheese, beef, chicken, ham, etc. With these, she will be able to achieve her dream of being independent.

loans.name: Kulthum

texts.en:
Kulthum is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 20 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, of which two go to school. She sells milk at the market on a retail basis. She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last year. She takes care of additional family members. She works seven days a week. She earns an additional income from tailoring clothes. She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy packets of milk and loaves of bread. Her major business challenges include transportation and the perishable nature of milk. She aspires to educate her children to university level and also to buy a fridge for storing milk. She lives in a rented house, where the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her main expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy loaves of bread and packets of milk

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
At the age of 39, Zainab is a married woman. She has three children. Her husband earns a low income to support the needs of their family members alone. In order to contribute to her family's income, Zainab started a business selling milk 10 years ago. She has two buffaloes to milk and she sells their milk in her locality, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Zainab looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells the products at different places on a daily basis. In this way, she earns a good amount of profit. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, Zainab requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
En el interior una vivienda, los muebles y camas lucen muy limpias y brillantes, el piso reluce la imagen de los visitantes.  Todo esto gracias a la dedicación de una mujer llamada María de 56 años y casada, con 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela de su comunidad, ella es la encargada de servicios de limpieza de dicha institución desde hace catorce años que ella ha venido ofreciendo de sus servicios para dicha vivienda.

La actividad que ella realiza en una vivienda es la de oficios domésticos dicha actividad a ella le a gustado realizar y por medio de ello ella puede tener un ingreso económico para su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y brindarles estudios a sus hijos para que en el mañana lleguen a profesionales.

El uso primordial que ella le dará al préstamo gestionado es para la compra de una estufa para poder realizar sus actividades domesticas sin ninguna complicación y problema. Las aspiraciones de doña María es la ampliación de su vivienda para poder tener condiciones de vida adecuadas y darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean mejores profesionales  en el campo laboral de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Inside the house the furniture and beds are all clean and shining and the image of the visitors is reflected from the floors. All this thanks to the dedication of a woman called María who is 56 years old, married with three children who all study at the local school.

She has been in charge of cleaning the school for the past 14 years when she started to offer her services to them. She does the domestic work in that building. She enjoys doing it and by doing it she can have economic income for her family and improve their living conditions. She also can provide education for her children so that they become professionals one day.

The fundamental use for the loan is to purchase a stove so that she can do her household work without complications and difficulty. María hopes to expand her house to have adequate living conditions and provide education for her children so that they become professionals in their community's labor market.

loans.use: buy a stove.

loans.name: Ardyanto

texts.en: Ardyanto is married and lives with his wife and child in Bogor, a city located about an hour from Jakarta. He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. To support his family, Ardyanto realized that he needed to find another source of income. He met one of Ruma's staff through a friend and decided to try selling mobile airtime. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan will help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plans to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 35-years-old, married and blessed with seven children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a rental house in the near future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Ismawati

texts.en: Ismawati, her husband and their son live in Tasikmalaya, a small city located about two hours from Bandung, West Java. Ismawati runs a small shop that sells women’s clothing and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she wanted to try out a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Ismawati is standing in front of her small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Rohimah

texts.en: Rohimah, her husband and their son live in Tasikmalaya, a small city located about two hours from Bandung, West Java. Ismawati runs a small shop that sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she wanted to try running a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business keeps running, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Rohimah is standing in her small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Fahrizal

texts.en: Meet Fahrizal. Fahrizal lives with his wife and their son in Cianjur, a small city situated at the foot of Mount Gede Pangrango, West Java. He runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Fahrizal is standing in his small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells used clothes at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shilling 200,000 to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. 

Her goal and inspirations is to increase her capital base so as to serve her customers better. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es: José de 65 años de edad habita en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 5 años se gana la vida gracias a la venta de productos básicos como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bebidas, manteca, etc.  Que realiza en su vivienda. José desea encementar el piso de 2 cuartos de su vivienda, ya que actualmente son de tierra, por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar; cemento, arena y grava, además necesitará pagar mano de obra necesaria para encementar el piso de 2 cuartos de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, age 65, lives in his own house.  He is an enterprising man.  For five years he has been earning a living thanks to selling basic products like corn, rice, beans, sugar, drinks, and shortening, etc.  He does this at his house.

José wishes to put down a cement floor in two of the rooms in his house.  This is because he currently has dirt floors.  That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel.  He will also need to pay for the labor needed to put down a cement floor in two rooms in his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel and to pay for the labor to put down a cement floor in two rooms of his house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old. She is married to Kiilu and together they have been blessed with one child who is six years old. Kiilu is a teacher hence provides additional income for the family.

Mary runs a restaurant, which she has operated for the last two years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 9,000.She has requested her second loan of Kshs. 20,000 which she will use to purchase chairs, tables and cutlery as well as crockery for her restaurant. Mary successfully repaid her previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to start another business.Her hope and dream is to be empowered in business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, cutlery and crockery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for  jeans (trousers)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 46-year-old married woman; she is working hard to cover her household expenditures. A year ago she started working on hand embroidery. She knows the art of embroidery and makes beautiful designs upon the demands of her customers. She earns a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. Her main customers are her neighbors and the people living nearby. 

In her 5th loan cycle, Shehnaz has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread and packs of beads, sequins and glittering material in various colors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good life to her six children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packs of beads, sequins and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Dadan

texts.en:
Meet Dadan. Dadan lives with his wife and their son in Cianjur, a small city situated at the foot of Mount Gede Pangrango, West Java. Dadan is an employee in a private company, and he also sells mobile airtime credits. 

He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Indra

texts.en:
Meet Indra. Indra lives with four other family members in in Tangerang, a satellite city located at the south of Jakarta. Indra  is an employee in a private company and he also sells mobile airtime credits. 

He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Markez Al-Rahma Group

texts.en:
This group is called Markez Al-Rahma. It consists of six women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Somia is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old, a married woman living with her spouse in the capital city of Sana'a. She has a university education. Due to a high rates of unemployment in the country, Somia couldn't find a job to look after her family. Her husband works outside the country and the money that he sends to his family is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. This makes the family have to deal with a financial crisis most days, and causes a shortage of foods materials inside the house. 

The (Ied) holiday is coming, and the family doesn't have the enough money to purchase the necessary expenses for the (Ied) holiday. In (Ied) holiday, all the people purchase gifts for their families and for any person they love. Somia's family doesn't have enough money to purchase that. 

For this reason, Somia applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many kinds of nuts for the (Ied) holiday for give them with other gifts for her family and for her friends.

Somia looks forward to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of nuts for the (Ied)holiday for her family and for her friends.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 32 years old. She is married, and has 3 children, ages 11, 9 and 1.  Many years ago, she established her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy chicks for her business.  

In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks for her business

loans.name: Andreina

texts.es: Andreina de 24 años de edad, ofrece a su clientela artículos como faldas, blusas, camisas, jeans, colonias, perfumes, cosméticos, mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a los cuales se encuentra afiliada. Su negocio nació en el año 2013, cuando siguió las sugerencias que algún día le hiciera su hermana,  para generar ingresos que le aportaran al bienestar de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus pequeños hijos en las edades de 1 y dos años.   Sus ventas las realiza a crédito diariamente y de contado, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Últimamente ha agregado pasabocas, aprovechando a su clientela fija a quien le ofrece también estos productos alimenticios. Su meta más adelante es adecuar el local en su vivienda y comprar una motocicleta,  que le permita trasladarse más efectivamente. Su mayor desafío es fidelizar a su clientela y lograr ahorros con el fin de alcanzar sus propósitos. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva mediante el cual comprará artículos como faldas, blusas, camisas, jeans, colonias, perfumes, cosméticos y también  pasabocas . Con ello aumentará sus ventas y sus utilidades mejorando así las condiciones de su negocio con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Andreina is 24 years old. She offers skirts, blouses, shirts, jeans, cologne, perfume and cosmetics to her clients from specialized guide or catalogs which she attaches to the product. Her business started in 2013, following a suggestion from her sister in order to generate income and support the well-being of her family, composed of her husband and young children aged one and two. She makes her sales on credit and in cash and works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Recently she has added snacks taking advantage of her steady customers to whom she also offers these food products.

Her goal for the future is to adapt her store which is in her house and buy a motorcycle which would allow her to travel more effectively. Her main challenge is to gain the loyalty of her clients and to save money to carry out her objectives. She is applying for a loan from Kiva with which she will buy things like skirts, blouses, shirts, jeans, cologne, perfume, cosmetics and snacks. Doing this she will increase her sales and her profits and improve the condition of her business with this investment.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, shirts, jeans, cologne, perfume, cosmetics and snacks.

loans.name: Leyvi Del Carmen

texts.es: Leyvi tiene 39 de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 16 años y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos típicos desde hace 5 años. Leyvi desea construir un cuarto para proteger su cocina para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la construcción como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
Leyvi, age 39, lives in her own house with her life partner, her 16 year old daughter, and her three year old son.  She is a very hard-working woman who has been making and selling typical dishes for five years.

Leyvi wishes to build a room to secure her kitchen.  In order to do so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy the needed materials for the construction.  She will buy things like bricks, cement, sand, and metal.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room for a kitchen.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is an old client, age 45 years, a resident of Rwentobo Kiyanja. He applied for a loan of 5,000,000 shs.  He is dealing in agriculture, and wants to improve it by adding cow dung and grass so that he can increase his output from his plantation, which can increase his income. 

But he lacks enough money to buy manure and hire labor; that’s why he has come to Ugafode for a loan, hoping that it can change his standard of living and he can harvest more matooke. 

He has a challenge of low matooke turnover from his  plantations, so he decided to come to Ugafode for a loan to improve his yields.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has three children aged twelve, eight and six. In 2007, Aminata established her business selling sets of dishs, bowls, baskets and buckets. She began her business because she wants to improve her life and not to be a burden to her husband. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, Aminata earns about Le 1,049,500 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy additional plastic bowls, baskets and buckets. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and raise her income. In the future, Aminata plans to employ someone to assist in the business, especially when she travels to buy more stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for plastic bowls, baskets and buckets

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is thirty-year-old Mariatu.  She is married and has no children.   She has three additional dependents, who live with her because of adoption.  In 2001, Mariatu established her ladies' dresses (blouses, skirts, and skinny tights) business. Since she is not educated, she thinks that doing business is preferable so that she can get her earnings to take care of her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are all ages. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,185,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy additional ladies' dresses and children's clothing. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and raise her income. In the future, Mariatu plans to educate her adopted children and build a house with the proceeds of the loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for ladies' dresses and children's clothing (blouses, skirts and skinny tights)

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром выходец из района Фархор, ему 39 лет. Он уже год работает таксистом на своем автомобиле Opel. Бахром единственный кормилец семьи, он должен обеспечивать жену и детей. Поэтому он работает с утра до позднего вечера без выходных. Бахром хочет расширить свою деятельность. Он хочет приобрести 9-местный микроавтобус марки Hyundai Starex для перевозки пассажиров. Так он смог бы увеличить доход от деятельности. Однако для купли этого микроавтобуса Бахрому не хватает 2000 долларов США, поэтому недостающую сумму он просит в кредит. Он верит, что благодаря кредиту его жизнь с финансовой стороны намного улучшится.
texts.en: Bahrom is a native of the Varkhor district. He is 39 years old. He has been working as a taxi driver using his own Opel car for one year. Bahrom is the sole provider for his family and has to support his wife and children. This is why he works from morning to late evening without days off. He wants to purchase a 9-seat minivan Hyundai Starex to transport passengers and increase his income from the business. However, Bahrom is short 2000 US dollars to make this purchase and is requesting this sum as a loan. He believes that, thanks to this loan, his life will improve greatly from a financial perspective.

loans.use: to purchase a 9-seat minivan Hyundai Starex to transport passengers

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Memuna.  In 1998, Memuna established her foodstuffs business. While she was with her mother, Memuna became interested in business because her mother was a small-scale trader. When she got married, she decided to start her own business to help her husband support their family.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Memuna requires this loan in order to buy maggi, onions, and rice for her business. She has managed to increase her monthly profit by 500,000 SLL, and part of this was used to give her children lunch, transportation, and school fees.  

Memuna’s plan to educate her children to the university level is still standing. Memuna is honest and hardworking. Her eldest son is waiting on his W.A.S.S.C.E result which will be out in September or October and she is all set to make a payment for him to the university if he passes the exams.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy maggi, onions, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group

texts.en:
Victor, aged 33, is a member of Tukolerewamu Wakaliga group, a mother of three who are school-going children. Victor dropped out of school and she got married at the early age of 20. Her husband  being a businessman encouraged her to begin a business, thus in 2009 she began a business of timber at Kabusu Nalukolongo, a city suburb, which is doing well.  She began her business with a little capital in order to supplement the earnings of her husband so as to look after their family. 

Through getting loans from UGAFODE, her business has improved and she is doing well. Victor approached UGAFODE for a third loan through the group so that she can buy more timber for the business. She is very hard-working, trustworthy and focused.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Apsara

texts.en:
Apsara is 40 years old and married with 2 children aged 21 and 18.

Many years ago, she established  her cow-raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she is able to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW, and has used her most recent loan to buy a young dairy cow. In the future, Apsara hopes to improve her family's financial situation. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.
  
Apsara thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children. Gloria has a business knitting sweaters. She has been in this business for 13 years, and she works seven days a week. Gloria sells her products in a shop, wholesale or retail. Gloria has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO, which she will use to buy more materials for making sweaters. She also generates additional income through part-time teaching. 

Gloria's main business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. Gloria lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sweaters.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, age 14.  Many years ago, she established her poultry farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chicks for her business.  

In the future, Mamata plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира красивая, но скромная молодая женщина в возрасте 20 лет. Она рано вышла замуж и уже имеет одного маленького ребенка. Ее муж вынужденно работает вдали от семьи, в чужой стране. Мунира живет с маленьким ребенком, свекровью и свёкорю в районе Кубадиён. Она от свекрови научилась купле-продаже миндаля. Уже два года Мунира самостоятельно занимается этим торговым бизнесом. Она покупает миндаль с близлежащих деревень и затем выводит на рынок на продажу. Чтобы зкупить очередную партию миндаля, Мунира просит кредит. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Munira is a pretty, but shy young, 20-year-old woman. She got married early and already has one small child. Her husband is forced to work far away from the family, in another country. Munira lives with her small child, mother-in-law and father-in-law in the Qubadiyon district. She learned how to resell almonds from her mother-in-law. Munira has been already involved in this business independently from two years. She buys almonds from nearby villages and then resells them at a market. Munira is requesting this loan to buy more almonds. She really hopes for the support.

loans.use: to buy almonds for resale

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1965 году. Зулфия замужем и имеет 2 сыновей. Им 24 и 19 лет. Ее старший сын женат. Зулфия работает более 20 лет фармацевтом. Она имеет большой опыт в этой сфере и обладает хорошими знаниями. Ее коллеги уважают ее и знают ее как ответственного и порядочного человека. Зулфия данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как ее невестка больна, и она должна срочно лечить ее.  Зулфия запрашивает займ на сумму 7100 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения невестки. Она ждет вашу доброту и ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1965. Zulfiya is married and has 2 sons, who are 24 and 19 years old. Her oldest son is married. Zulfiya has been working as a pharmacist for over 20 years. She has a lot of experience and good knowledge in this area. Her colleagues respect her and know her as a responsible and decent person. At the present time, Zulfiya needs financial support because her daughter-in-law is ill and has to seek treatment soon. Zulfiya is requesting a loan in the amount of 7100 somoni to buy medicine to treat her daughter-in-law. She awaits your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine to treat her daughter-in-law

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es: Calixto de 58 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos adultos y se dedica a ofrecer servicios odontológicos y de rehabilitación oral, desde hace 20 años, cuando terminó sus estudios de odontología en el país vecino de Ecuador. Su carrera inició pues siempre se inclinó por las ciencias de la salud y su gran vocación de servicio al ser humano, como mitigar el dolor físico y mejorar la calidad de vida del paciente, lo llevaron a concentrar sus objetivos de estudio en esta profesión. Hoy ofrece servicios de salud oral, como profilaxis, calzas con resina, rehabilitación oral, endodoncia, desde su consultorio, ubicado al costado de su vivienda. Su meta es lograr mayor cobertura de pacientes y más adelante hacer una gran remodelación al local. En la actualidad Calixto está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará amalgama, foto curado, anestesia, resina, material quirúrgico etc.; esta inversión lo ayudará a contar con mayores insumos de trabajo y logrará así una mejor atención a sus pacientes, prestando sustancialmente un servicio de mayor calidad .
texts.en:
Calixto is 58 years old, and father of two adult children. He has worked offering dental and oral rehabilitation services for 20 years, since he finished his studies in dentistry in the neighbouring country of Ecuador. 

His studies began because he had always been inclined towards health sciences, and his major vocation was to serving others, such as how to mitigate physical pain and improve a patient's quality of life. These factors brought him to focus his studies in this profession. 

Today he offers oral health services, such as prophylaxis, resin shims, oral rehabilitation, and endodontics, from his office located on the side of his home. His goal is to achieve better coverage for patients and later to do a large renovation of his space.

Currently, Calixto is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation has given him, with which he will buy amalgam, a curing light, anesthesia, resin, surgical equipment, etc. This loan will help him to count on higher labour inputs and thus acheive better attention to his patients, providing a substantially better quality of service.

loans.use: to buy amalgam, a curing light, anesthesia, resin, surgical equipment, etc.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.en: Moses, a resident of Nansana, a city suburb, is aged 36 and a member of Ubumwe group. He is married with three children who are school-going, Moses  began as a taxi conductor, saved some money, and began a retail shop which has been existence for the last three years and which he believes is doing well.  He approached UGAFODE for a second loan of 1,000,000 shillings to add to his stock of rice, corn flour, sugar, and soap among other items in his business. The customers and neighbors describe Moses as hard-working, honest, and focused.

loans.use: to add to his stock of rice, corn flour, sugar, and soap among other items

loans.name: Bertha Dilia

texts.es:
La Joven Bertha es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a sus dos hijas. Su actividad comercial es la venta de Ropa usada, les ofrece su producto a los vecinos de su comunidad y también sale a vender a las aldeas cercanas.
Bertha además cuenta con la ayuda económica de su esposo ya que el está en Estados Unidos y le envía remesas frecuentemente lo cual viene a ayudar mucho en sus ingresos, necesita el préstamo para poder comprar una refrigeradora para poder realizar otra actividad económica la cual es una venta de comida. 
Bertha espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a él podrá contar con lo necesario para poder empezar a atender a la clientela que seguramente será mucha ya que la caseta donde se ubicara está situada en un punto estratégico con bastante afluencia de personas y espera obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Ella espera hacer que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia para que cumplan sus metas. 


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - Julio - 2014
texts.en:
Bertha is a responsible and hard-working person who lives in a community in the north of Honduras together with her two children. Her business is selling used clothing which she offers to the neighbors in her community. She also sells in neighboring villages. Bertha also has the economic support of her husband who is in the United states and frequently sends money home which helps a lot with her income.

Bertha needs the loan to buy a refrigerator to carry out another business which is selling meals. Bertha hopes that the loan will help her as she will have what she needs to start to serve her clients who should be numerous. Her stall is located at a strategic location with lots of people passing. She hopes to generate more income which will improve the quality of living for her family in their home. She wants her business to continue to expand and in this way support her family and reach her goals.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her second business.

loans.name: Maritzabel

texts.es:
Martizabel una joven de 24 años de edad que tiene un hermoso hijo de 3 años de edad, desde muy joven mostro su madurez y compromiso con todo lo que hacía desde casarse con el papa del hijo, hasta buscar la manera de darle una vida digna a este. 

Trabajo como vendedora en almacenes, supermercados etc. pero su deseo es poder tener un negocio para estar cerca de su hijo y siempre generando recursos pues su matrimonio es muy joven. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar una tienda en su hogar y está muy motivada por que le dan la oportunidad de ser independiente y tiene la fe de poder triunfar pues en su sector residencial carecen de una tienda y sería una muy buena oportunidad para poner un negocio sostenible. 

Maritzabel pide la ayuda, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas muy puntales, pues en esta tienda está depositado el futuro de su hijo y con él no se juega. 

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 2 vitrinas, 1 congeladores, estantería, exhibidores y surtido de la canasta familiar.
texts.en:
Martizabel is a 24 year old young woman, and she has a beautiful three year old son.  Ever since she was very young, she has demonstrated her maturity and commitment with everything she has done from marrying the father of her child to looking for the way to give her child a decent life.  She worked as a salesperson in stores and supermarkets, etc.  However, her wish is to be able to have a business so that she can be close to her son and always generate resources.  The couple is very young.

She is requesting a loan to start a store in her house.  She is very motivated about being given the opportunity to be independent.  She has faith that she will be able to triumph because her residential area needs a store.  It would be a very good opportunity to set up a sustainable business.

Maritzabel is asking for help.  She pledges to make her payments very punctually.  The future of her son is placed in this store, and you do not play with that.

She will use the loan to buy two show cases, a freezer, shelving, display cabinets, and stock of basic needs items.

loans.use: to buy two show cases, a freezer, shelving, display cabinets, and stock of basic needs items.

loans.name: Manika

texts.en:
Manika hails from Maynaguri. She is 46 years old and passed grade 11. She is married and is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter), who are students of grade 12 and grade 6. Her husband, 56-year-old Tarun, is associated with agribusiness. Manika's husband has been a farmer for many years, offering safe and healthy products for human consumption. He mainly grows paddy rice, which is a much demanded crop in their region. He knows that he must work hard and be very dedicated in order to support his family. It is for this reason that he would like to increase his productivity and secure a future rooted in the work he does in the fields each day.

Manika is also trying to help her husband. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity for her husband's business to purchase agricultural inputs (seeds, manure, pesticides, etc.), which will allow her husband to have greater productivity in paddy. She hopes to begin a new era in their crop-growing: one that is more productive and beneficial for her family.

Manika is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single mother of five children who lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells produce like groundnuts, posho (ugali), beans and millet. 

When she realized that her income couldn't cover the family's needs, she decided to start up a drug store for extra income. She would like to educate her children despite the hardship of inadequate finances.

She therefore wants a credit facility in order to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 27-year-old gentleman and single. His main source of income is from maize milling and he obtains side income from buying and selling produce. He began the business in order to generate income. He is hard-working and hopes to establish a bigger produce business but currently he faces a challenge of defaulting customers. He hopes to utilize this loan to buy  maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy  maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Toshy

texts.ru: Тоши родилась в 1955 году. Она женщина с прекрасной душой. Она посвятила всю свою жизнь своей семье. Ее муж Рахмон работает охранником и получает маленькую зарплату. Они жили крайне бедно, и поэтому она была просто вынуждена найти источник дохода. Тоши начала свой бизнес откармливанием и продажей скота. Тоши просыпается рано утром и начинает свой рабочий день. Ее рабочий день начинается с того как она кормит коров и чистит их. Тоши довольно своей деятельностью. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Toshy was born in 1955. She is a woman with a beautiful soul. She devoted her whole life to her family. Her husband, Rahmon, works as a security guard and earns a small salary. They lived quite poorly, and she simply had to find another source of income. Toshy started her own business of fattening up and selling livestock. Toshy wakes up early in the morning and starts her work day. Her work day begins with feeding and cleaning cows. Toshy is satisfied with her business. She wants to increase her working capital and is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy livestock. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Vyara Group

texts.fr:
Pierre fait partie du groupe  Vyara et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 37 ans et est marié à Chantal,une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 13 ans,dont 4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis  4 ans. 

Il est  à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  rehausser le capital,et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pierre is a member of the Vyara group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 years old and married to Chantal, who is a saleswoman. They have five children between the ages of one and thirteen, of whom four attend school.

He has been selling clothing for four years.

This is his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

Over the coming years, he hopes to increase his capital and see his children through school.

loans.use: he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 34 years old. He has two children who are 3 and 5 years old. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. Denis sells retail items like juice, sugar, biscuits, salt, and plastic items. He also sells used clothes to earn more income. He has hopes of expanding his business, but he is challenged by price fluctuation and competition.

He is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like juice, sugar, biscuits, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like juice, sugar, biscuits, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man, aged 32 years, with three children, two of whom attend school. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells electrical goods and has got a saloon to boost his income. He started the business so as to cater for the family's increasing needs. He desires to educate his children to university having realized its importance.

Stephen needs a loan to buy more electrical material to sell.

loans.use: to buy  more electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 40-year-old single man living in Masindi, Uganda. 

He works as a farmer, growing crops both for sale and home consumption. He has hopes of expanding his business and educating his children, despite the difficulties of high transportation costs and weather changes that affect his business.

Julius intends to use the loan to clear land for farming.

loans.use: to clear land for farming.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged 45 and single, with eight children aged between 9 and 26. She owns a produce store (selling and buying beans, maize and cassava)  and makes extra income through farming. She started her business to support her children like any loving mother. Her major challenge is competition and seasonal changes. She is hard-working and will use the loan to buy beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson lives in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, rice, and beans. He also does welding. He started his business to generate household income. He hopes to increase his inventory. High prices of iron materials are a challenge to his welding business. He will use the loan to buy materials for making gates, doors, and windows.

loans.use: to buy materials for making gates, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a forty-seven-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

His main business is cattle fattening alongside agriculture, where he earns some extra income. He started this business in order to improve his standard of living. He faces hardships such as competition and the theft of his cows, but in spite of this he dreams of owning a modernized farm. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 34 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a married man with nine children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who deals in the buying and selling of maize, groundnuts, millet, and beans. He gets other income from his cereal-milling machine. He began his business in order to improve his standard of living and build a permanent home, but a limiting factor of capital and high cost of fuel to run his milling machine is what he complains about. 

Sulaiman will use the loan to purchase maize, groundnuts and beans for resale.

loans.use: to purchase maize, groundnuts and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Djebeleton  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJEBELETON 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TAMARO, un des villages de la commune de DAH cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’ arachide  avec  SALI,  femme assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à DAH, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 47 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djebeleton3 group are married women who are on average 36 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in Tamaro, one of the villages in the Dah circle of San in the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Siri Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their agricultural affairs through the winter.
This is their fourth loan from the institution, the previous loans were repaid.
Sali grows peanuts, she is the woman sitting in the middle in the photo.
With her loan she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay the labour costs for the upkeep of one hectare.
After the harvest, she will sell the production in the village and in Dah to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average profit of 47 500FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: with labour costs, purchasing products for the earth, small farming tools and seeds.

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
Негмат жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 50 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Негмат живёт со своей семьёй в небольшой деревушке. Он не смог получить высшего образования так как в его семье были финансовые затруднения. Жена Негмата также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Негмат работает шофёром грузовой машины. Он перевозит груз с с разных городов. Также Негмат подрабатывает мастером. Сын Негмата работает на продуктовой фирме и приносит также в дом доход. Сейчас Негмат собирается женить своего старшего сына. Он готовиться к свадебному мероприятию. Для этого нужно купить очень много вещей для приданного. Но у Негмата не хватает денежных средств, которые он накопил для свадьбы. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы своего сына. Негмат очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку
texts.en:
Negmat is a happy and hardworking 50-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. He comes to Arvand for the first time after learning about the opportunity to receive financial support. Negmat lives with his family in a small village. He could not obtain a higher education because his family had financial difficulties. Negmat's wife also does not have an education and is a homemaker. She is involved in household works and raising the children.

Negmat works as a truck driver to earn a livable income. He transports loads from various towns. Also, Negmat works as repairman. Negmat's son works at a food company and brings another income home. Now Negmat is planning to marry off his oldest son. He is preparing for the wedding, for which he needs to purchase many things for the bridewealth, but Negmat does not have enough savings for the wedding. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy a bridewealth for his son's wedding. Negmat very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: buy a bridewealth for the wedding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs for fattening to improve his business and provide a higher quality of life for his family.

loans.name: Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS LINDAS” iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de regalos, venta de cocoa, tienda de barrio, venta de muebles, carpintería, panadería, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de regalos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que tienen el mismo negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de utensilios domésticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente los decorará para comercializarlos en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas Lindas" (beautiful roses) will initiate the twentieth cycle with Pro Mujer's German Busch branch. The group is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Lidia is the President. Lidia became a member of Rosas Lindas four years ago, when she was invited to join Pro Mujer by a friend who is also a client. The members of Rosas Lindas run a variety of businesses, including: gift sales, cocoa sales, corner market, furniture sales, carpentry, bakery and cosmetic sales. The loan that they will receive will benefit microentrepreneurs like Lidia.  Lidia is the owner of the gift business, a trade she learned from her parents who have the same sort of business.

Lidia requests this loan to increase her working capital, namely, to purchase domestic appliances on wholesale through the markets in El Alto. She will then decorate the appliances to sell them in her shop. This business allows Lidia to generate sufficient resources to support her family (she is married and has three children). When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lidia said that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase domestic appliances on wholesale.

loans.name: Telma Seleyma

texts.es:
Telma de 33 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad y su esposo.
Telma  se dedica al negocio de pupusas desde hace 7 años, ya que sus padres no pudieron darle su estudio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar sillas y mesas para que los clientes coman alli mismo las deliciosas pupusas. 

 Telma en un futuro se ve con un puesto de pupusas muy amplio y con mucha demanda  y un buen servicio al cliente y así obtener mejores ingresos  para darle una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien en el futuro.
texts.en:
Telma is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 3. She has been selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) for seven years. Her parents were not able to provide her with an education.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy chairs and tables so that her customers can enjoy her delicious “pupusas”. In the future, Telma would like to have a larger food stand, experience greater demand, and offer good service to her customers. This will help her generate more income so that she can provide a good education for her children in order that they can become outstanding individuals in the future.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her food stand.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a twenty-eight-year-old hardworking single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a news anchor and that is her main source of income though she also owns a motorcycle that is used for transport. She was inspired to start up her income-generating activity by the poor living standard that she was experiencing. She faces a challenge of language barrier but has hopes of becoming a well-known news anchor.

She is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle for her transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation business.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de dos años, ella se mantiene al  pendiente del bienestar de su familia; Verónica se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, para obtener ingresos con los que puede aportar en los gastos de su hogar, su negocio nació hace seis años, su horario de atención es de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, lo aprendió mientras ayudaba a su madre a realizarlo, una ventaja es que ya tiene clientes que mantienen la fidelidad a su negocio.
Con el capital comprara repollo, yuca, sandias, papayas, zapotes, naranjas, etc., surtirá con mercadería fresca su negocio, pues según su experiencia en esta temporada las ventas aumentan, espera mejorar su situación económica para cancelar sus cuotas con puntualidad y seguir apoyando a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su hogar.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más diversificado, tener una mayor rentabilidad y dar a su familia mejor alimentación, educación y vesturio.
texts.en:
Veronica lives with her life’s partner and two year old son and is concerned for her family’s wellbeing.  Veronica sells fruits and vegetables to obtain an income with which to pay the household expenses.  She has been in business for six years and works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.  She learned how to do this while she helped her mother and she has the advantage of having loyal customers.

She will use the money from this loan to buy cabbage, yucca, watermelon, papayas, sapotes, oranges, etc.  She will stock her business with fresh merchandise because this is the season when her sales increase.  She hopes to improve her financial situation so she can pay her debts on time and continue to help her partner with the household expenses.  Her dreams are to have a more diverse business, better profits, and provide her family with better food, education and clothing.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha, 38 years of age, hails from Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She has a small family comprised of her husband, one son and one daughter. Her son is in grade 7, and the daughter is too young for school. She is married to Sudhir, who is a farmer. Her husband is doing paddy and vegetable cultivation. He grows vegetables for four months after the harvesting of paddy and earns handsome money. Her husband gets vegetable seeds, vegetable plants and fertilizers from the town for vegetable cultivation. Their agribusiness provides them with sustainable income by which they can somehow manage the household expenses. But their children are growing, and as a result, their expenses are also increasing. Shikha and her husband want to expand their business by cultivating more paddy.

Shikha wants to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for vegetable and paddy cultivation to earn some money. She has sought a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity. She wants to purchase farm inputs, such as good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc., with the loan. She has a long-term desire to educate her children in a better school. She hopes that will be fulfilled with the additional income generated from this business.

Shikha is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Samir Eduardo

texts.es: Servicios de recargas minutos a celulares, fotocopiaje y papelería,accesorios  son los negocios con los cuales genera ingresos Samir, hombre de 30 años que habita con su cónyuge y su hija de 3 años de edad al suroccidente de la ciudad. Su idea de negocio inició, cuando decidió aprovechar su conocimiento como técnico electrónico y generar un ingreso adicional a su inicial y principal negocio de fotocopiaje, el cual hoy tiene ubicado en su propia casa y complementa con productos de papelería belleza y accesorios tipo miscelanea, que vende de contado desde los lunes a los domingos iniciando a las 6:30 de la mañana y finalizando su labor a las 8 de la noche; Samir permanece comprando en almacenes del centro de la ciudad y vendiendo principalmente a su vecinos en el sector donde habita. Su meta es lograr un amplio surtido de mercancias y finalmente adquirir una casa propia, para generar mayor bienestar a su familia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina, productos de papeleria, y de belleza con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y alcanzar una mayor utilidad,  inversión con la cual mejoraría de esta manera su negocio .
texts.en: Cell phone minute reloading services, photo-copying, stationery, and accessories are the businesses that Samir uses to generate income. He's a 30 year old man who lives with his spouse and 3 year old daughter in the southwestern part of the city. The idea for his business began when he decided to make use of the knowledge acquired as an electronics technician to generate income in addition to his first and primary business, photocopies. It's located in his home and he supplements it with stationery products, beauty products, and miscellaneous accessories that he sells in limited quantities from monday to sunday starting at 6:30 am and concluding at 8 pm. Samir makes his purchases at downtown warehouses and mainly sells to residents of his area. His goal is to acquire an ample supply of merchandise and finally obtain a house of his own to improve his family's well-being. Currently he's applying for a credikiva, the first financing he's asked the Mario Santo Domingo foundation for, and he'll use it to purchase a display case, stationery products, and beauty products with the objective of increasing his sales and reach higher profits that he would invest in the improvement of his business.

loans.use: To purchase a display case, stationery products, and beauty products

loans.name: Inoyatjon

texts.ru: Иноятчон родилась в 1981 году. Она живет вместе со своей семьей на северной части страны. Иноятчон воспитывает 2 детей. Ее муж занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Иноятчон 4 года назад начала свою деятельность предоставлением услуги швеи. Она шьёт как национальные, так и европейские стили одежды. Иноятчон имеет своих постоянных клиентов, благодаря хорошему сервису. Она нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как ее швейная машинка старая и недавно сломалась. Она должна купить новую швейную машинку и продолжить предоставить услуги своим клиентам. Если она не купит новую швейную машинку, она потеряет всех клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Inoyatjon was born in 1981. She lives with her family in the northern part of the country. Inoyatjon is raising 2 children. Her husband is involved in an entrepreneurship. Inoyatjon started her business of providing seamstress services 4 years ago. She sews national and European styles of clothing. Inoyatjon has regular clients, thanks to her great service. She needs financial assistance because her sewing machine recently broke down. She has to purchase a new sewing machine and continue providing her service to her customers. If she does not buy a new sewing machine, she will lose all of her clients. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, home furnishings and beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, madre de cinco hijos y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es emprendedora, dinámica, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el sexto anillo de su ciudad, que se caracteriza por el violento crecimiento demográfico, catalogada en el número 14 de las ciudades con crecimiento más rápido del mundo.
María es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con la que se ayuda para pagar los gastos de alimentación de sus cinco hijos. Ella desea incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, realizando la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda y con los beneficios pagar la alimentación de sus cinco hijos.
