texts.en: Maria is a 46 year old married mother of five children whose business is a neighborhood store that sells basic foods. She's enterprising, dynamic, hard-working, striving, and responsible. She runs her business in the sixth beltway of the city, which is known for the surging demographic growth that have made it the 14th fastest growing city in the world. Maria is enterprising, striving, strong, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is a neighborhood store which she uses to help pay for feeding her five children. She wants to increase her income to improve her family's quality of life, by purchasing basic foods wholesale. Those are the reasons why Maria is requesting a loan to purchase basic foods to stock her store so she can use the income to feed her five children.

loans.use: To purchase basic foods to stock her store and use the income to feed her five children.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El señor Manuel, una persona humilde mayor de edad, de estado civil casado, por diversas razones de la vida solo llego a estudiar  hasta el nivel primario, viven en su  casita que es propia junto a su esposa, ambos se dedican a la agricultura, su casa es de construcción rustica ubicada en la provincia Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba. Tiene tres hijos, la mayor de sus hijos está en el último año del colegio y los dos pequeños  aun asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación. La principal actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que más cultiva son papa, haba y arveja, como también la cebada en sus parcelas propias. El señor es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora al igual que su esposa y para ampliar y mejorar su producción se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa, para así aumentar sus ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is a modest older man who is married.  For various reasons, he was only able to complete his primary level education.  

He lives with his wife in a cottage that they own.  Both of them engage in agriculture.  Their house is made of basic materials and is located in Tiraque Province, which is part of the Department of Cochabamba.  

Manuel has three children, with the oldest one in her last year of high school.  The two younger ones attend an elementary school so that they can get a good education.  

Manuel’s main business activity is farming.  The products that he grows the most are potatoes, beans, and peas, as well as barley, on his own land.  He is a very responsible and hardworking individual, just like his wife.  In order to expand and improve his production, Manuel is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies, such as poultry feed and seed potatoes.  This will increase his earnings so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for his chickens and potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, irrigation equipment and other items to improve his plantain and corn crops.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace más de 8 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y de esta forma aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 33 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller. 

Trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de camisas y uniformes escolares; de esta forma intenta generar los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina recubridora, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Mariluz sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur whose field is garment making, and she provides her services to third parties.

Everything began over 8 years ago when she was working as an employee in a garment workshop and that's how she learned the trade. Now, at the age of 33, she has her own workshop.

She works every day and her strength is making shirts and school uniforms, and this is how she's trying to generate income to help her husband with household expenses.

The loan she's requesting will be invested in the purchase of a sewing machine, so she can fulfill her customers' orders and deliver them in a timely manner with the objective of increasing production, acquiring new contracts, and allow her micro-business to continue operating.

Mariluz dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and increase production levels so it can create job opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her business and be able to improve production.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada).
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, alegre, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ que está localizado al noreste del departamento de La Paz, a una distancia aproximada de 58 Km. de la ciudad de El Alto a través de la carretera asfaltada La Paz - Copacabana.
Mariana es de tez morena, cabello largo trenzado negro, estatura mediana, viste de forma tradicional, su lengua materna es el aymara y lo combina con español para el comercio. Ella se dedica a la venta de papa y chuño(papa deshidratada), en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en diferentes comunidades a razón de 1 por día, de martes a domingo; Martes: Palcoco, Miércoles: Tuquia, Jueves: Kerani, Viernes: Chachacomani, Sábado: Batallas, Domingo: Peñas.
Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Debido a la competencia del lugar ella necesita realizar la compra de papa y chuño(papa deshidratada) por mayor para obtener mejores beneficios económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Mariana solicita un préstamo para la compra de papa y chuño(papa deshidratada) por mayor para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 23 years old woman, she is single, has no kids and she sells potatoes and chuño (dried potatoes). She is enterprising, determined, cheerful, tenacious, responsible, and hard-working. She works in a community called Batallas, which is located north of de district of La Paz, approximately 58 km. from the city of El Alto. You can get there through the La Paz paved road - Copacabana. Mariana's complexion is dark, she has long black braided hair, average height, and she dresses in the traditional way. Her native tongue is Aymara, she combines it with Spanish to do business. 

She sells potatoes and chuños around the different community fairs, one a day, Tuesday-Sunday; Tuesday: Palcoco, Wednesday: Tuquia, Thursday: Kerani, Friday: Chachacomani, Saturday: Batallas, Sunday: Peñas.

Her dream is to get a better income, so she can improve her life. Due to the competition, she needs to buy potatoes and chuño wholesale to obtain better profits. That´s why Mariana is requesting a loan, to buy potatoes and chuño to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes and chuño (dried potatoes) to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is a 30-year-old energetic and optimistic entrepreneur from Maynaguri who believes that hard work has its own reward. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter) who are students. She is a well-known dairy farmer. She is married to Akhil, aged 37 years. He is a day laborer. He has a very inconsistent income, as his work depends on availability.

To add some income to the family fund, Mina has been rearing animals for many years and developed a passion for dairy farming. To generate income, she sells dairy products, such as butter, paneer, and curd from her farm, at the local market and in her neighborhood.

Now she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a quality dairy cow which, she hopes, will produce more milk per day. Milk and milk products sold from this cow will provide Mina with a sufficient income to provide a decent lifestyle. Income from milk sales is preferable for a farmer like her, since it comes regularly.

Mina's extra income that she will generate from the dairy cow will satisfy her family’s needs. Her first preference is her children's education. She wants to provide better education to them for their bright future.

She is thanking Kiva and BJS for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products selling business.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita is 33 years old and hails from Maynaguri. She is married to Madhusudan, and has no children. She is a homemaker who engages herself in household work and looks after her husband. She attended school until primary level and could not continue further due to her parents’ poor economic resources.

Her husband, 38 years old, runs a house painting business. Her husband paints colors on the houses of their locality. He is famous for his efficiency in this field. Being the only source of income for the family, he strives hard to make the business successful. He has a very good relationship with his clients for his polite behavior, and at the same time, for doing his work quite efficiently and perfectly. He wants to grow his business using these qualities, but he can't do so, due to his inadequate capital.

So, Sumitra is asking for a loan from BJS to purchase paint colors, brushes, color trays and other things. She will use her profits to improve her family's living standard and help with the expansion of her husband's business. She aspires to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future with the profit from the business.

She is thankful to her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy paint colors, brushes and other materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Yancy

texts.en:
Yancy is 32 years old and has one child in school. Yancy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Yancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl toda la vida se ha desempeñado en el campo agropecuario mas no como agricultor si no ofreciendo sus servicios como fumigador y servicios de guadañadora, pero pensando en que es un trabajo poco estable pues muchos campesinos optan por realizar estas labores para rebajar costos, Saúl está pensando en tener su propio terreno y cultivar.


Solicita un crédito para la compra de guadañadora y fumigadores, con los que cubrirá algunos trabajos que le dejaran capital para comenzar a pagar una cuota de un terreno y trabajar la tierra. 

Sueña con ser un agricultor y seguir ejerciendo sus actividades para seguir apoyando incondicionalmente a sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad.
texts.en:
All is life, Saúl has worked in the farming industry.  He works not so much as a farmer but rather offering his services as a fumigator and offering mowing services.  But, considering that it is not very stable work, because many farmers opt to do that work themselves to lower their costs, Saúl is thinking of getting his own land and planting it. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase a mowing machine and fumigators.  With them he will do some work for which has already been given a down payment so he could start making payments on his land and start working it.  

Saúl dreams of being a farming and continuing with his businesses so he can keep unconditionally supporting his two children, who are seven and three years old respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a mowing machine and fumigator to carry out his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase: sheet metal, wood, nails to extend his home's shed and pay the fee for installing electricity.

loans.name: Santos Andres

texts.es: Santos de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña recién nacida y un niño de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 10 años se gana la vida como jornalero, además tratando de mejorar sus ingresos cultiva maíz y maicillo para el consumo. Santos desea construir una pila en su vivienda, ya que el deposito para almacenar agua con el que cuenta actualmente se encuentra deteriorado. Es por ello que Santos solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: ladrillo,cemento,arena grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir de la pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos is 36 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion and their two children, a five-year-old son and a newborn daughter. He is an enterprising man who has been earning his living as a farm laborer for the past 10 years. In addition, he is trying to improve his income by growing corn and sorghum for consumption.

Santos wants to build a water basin for his home since the repository he is currently using for storing water has deteriorated. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron. In addition, he will pay for the labor needed to build the water basin for his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a water basin for his home.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta is married with 2 children; she is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. Roberta is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to buy 15 sacks of fertilizers for her farm. Roberta has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Roberta hopes to become a rice supplier in her municipality.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Anthoneta

texts.en:
Anthoneta is a 39-year-old housewife who is married to Lasarus, a 39-year-old laborer. In their marriage, they have been blessed with four children, namely Desi, 21, who assists her mother to do all daily housework; Nyongki, 19, a laborer at a seaport; Marlis, 17, and Lexi, 16, both in the 2nd grade of Vocational High School majoring in Graphic Design. 

As a housewife, Anthoneta takes care of her husband and four children and does all the housework. Recently, her two youngest children, Marlis and Lexi, are about to start a new academic year entering the second grade of Vocational High School. They need extra money to pay their school fees and to purchase other school items. However, Anthoneta lacks money for this. Her husband's income is only enough to fulfill their daily needs. Therefore, she applied for an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to fulfill those schooling requirements.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and  purchase other school items

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 61 years old, married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like yeast, flour, sugar, butter, etc.

Zenaida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of hes family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like yeast, flour, sugar, butter, etc

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 54 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice farm in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to pays for laborers' salaries for the rice harvest.

Beatriz has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice farm for 2 years and also earns income from a general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pays for laborers' salaries for the rice harvest.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 35 years old and married with one child in school; Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, spices, soap, and shampoo.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Editha  works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing. Editha is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of banana to sell.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat, 56, is a Palestinian refugee. He is married and the father of one child. The family lives in a camp in Lebanon.

Because of the limited work opportunities afforded these refugees, Izzat has worked for the past 26 years as an auto mechanic. His income is low, and this is making it increasingly difficult for him to cover his family’s expenses. 

For this reason Izzat acquired a 1,000 USD loan through Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to cover some of his recent and necessary requested living expenses. He has to make some maintenance to his house to keep it a healthy living place, and buy necessary home products. 

He hopes to stay capable of supporting his family and providing them with the necessary living needs

loans.use: to cover some recent and necessary requested living expenses such as maintenance to his house to keep it a healthy living place and to buy necessary home products.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old, married, and has two children.

She is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a piglet to raise and buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a piglet to raise and buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business like gasoline and fishing net.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. Erlinda earns more income from farming rice and from a buy and sell nipa roofing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family .

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business like gasoline and fishing net.

loans.name: Jeramy

texts.en:
Jeramy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Jeramy has been in this business for 2 years. Jeramy earns more income from food vending.

Jeramy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 54 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Julie has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear (clothing).

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

She has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Carol would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children. She works hard to help pay for her children’s needs for food, health, clothing, and education.

With her husband, Rifat has been farming for many years. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them at the local market. She has gradually improved her income with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to buy different types of seeds, insecticides and pesticides Rifat has applied for a 45,000 PKR loan. These purchases will help her to grow more crops that will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Tessie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a furniture shop.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Persinith

texts.en:
Persinith is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Persinith is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Persinith has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Susana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her sidecar/motorcycle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and married with four children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, chocolate drink, sugar, milk, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Victoria aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, chocolate drink, sugar, milk, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling clothes in the Philippines.

She requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional clothes to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Alita requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Alita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Alita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alona works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Alona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is a 51-year-old married woman living in Jabal Alhussein, Jordan. She is a mother of two. Her husband owns a servants office. Mervat has been helping her husband financially by buying raw materials and making air fresheners and soap at her house for three years. She is seeking to participate in bazaars and to take courses in the future. To do so, she needs to expand her business by buying more raw materials to raise her productivity. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making soap and air freshners

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Janette has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from her general store.

Janette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en: Rowaida is a 29-year-old married lady, living with her husband and three sons and daughters. Her husband is a retired man, and his pension isn't enough to cover her children's needs. Therefore, one year ago Rowaida started her business, selling chips, chocolates and candy at her house. This business has been profitable. She is now receiving more requests from her customers for more products that she doesn't have. Accordingly, she is requesting a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more chips, chocolates, and candy that her customers have requested.

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
After 14 years with a company Lara had loved and respected as well as having managed a consistently successful office and top recruiters in the company year after year, Lara found that she was unable to manage and lead her office and staff the way they wanted her to, so she knew it was time to leave.  

She never had a doubt that she was ready and could be successful and she was excited to start her own company and to give the opportunity she had enjoyed so much to others by creating a company that she would want to work for that valued hard work and mutual respect among all of the contributors and an environment where recruiters had the support and tools to be successful as well as the freedom and autonomy to do what they do best.  Lara loves what she does and she loves sharing the opportunity with others and touching the lives of so many people out there looking for their next job and career.  

She works with all types of companies and people to make employment matches and help others grow their business and develop their careers.  It’s hard work, challenging, exciting, and very rewarding.   

The biggest challenges have been that everything comes from Lara. All of the corporate and administrative work is done by her; she does all of the accounting and negotiating and working with vendors, payroll, advertising, and HR; she doesn’t have a corporate office to handle any of that. It’s all her, but she loves that side of it as well.  It’s been exciting and she has learned so much and learns more every day.  

Growing the business is a challenge, hiring takes money, and managing the company’s cash flow has challenges at times.  Lara is using the Kiva loan to hire, and this hire will increase the company’s revenue and cash flow for more hiring and growth in the very near future!  Lara hopes to see Aym Alliance continue to grow and she has no limits in mind!  She hopes Aym Alliance is a place where people love to work and find a home where they can reach their goals in their careers and that she continues to help client companies and client candidates grow their businesses and develop their careers as well!

loans.use: to hire new employees

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррина жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Заррина живёт в сельской местности. Сама Заррина работает на рынке продавщицей овощей и фруктов. А муж Заррина работает строителем в России. Он каждый месяц присылает домой денежные средства. Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую они получают, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье.

Заррина сотрудничает с Арванд. Она получала кредит на потребительские нужды, а также на развитие своего бизнеса. Заррина говорит, что после того, как она начала сотрудничать с Арванд, качество её жизни стало постепенно улучшаться. В данное время Заррина вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Заррина обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zarrina is a happy and responsible woman. She is married and has three children. Zarrina lives with her family in a rural area. Zarrina works at a market selling vegetables and fruits. Zarrina's husband works as a construction worker in Russia. He sends money home on a monthly basis. They love their children very much and try to teach them wholeheartedly because they wish to have educated children. However, their salaries are not enough to cover all of the family needs.

Zarrina partners with Arvand. She previously received a loan for consumer needs and also for developing her business. Zarrina says that the quality of her life started to gradually improve after she has begun working with Arvand. At the present time, Zarrina and her husband want to repair the house, where they live, to improve their living conditions, but don't have enough of their own funds to do so. Zarrina came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy construction materials to repair her house. She hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Firoza

texts.en:
Firoza is a 24-year-old mother of two sons. She lives with her husband and children in a village, Madhya Boragari in rural West Bengal. She studied only up to grade 4. She is an energetic, enthusiastic lady, who always tries to generate more income for the well-being of her family. One of her sons is a student of grade 5, and the other one is too young for school.

Firoza's husband, Rahim, owns and drives a cycle-van for transportation service in the village in order to make a living. It is a kind of cycle-operated transport which is used in rural West Bengal to carry loads and people to other villages and local markets. He has been operating this business for many long years to earn income for the family. Now their children are growing older, so the cost of the family is also increasing. Thus, Rahim decided to expand his business to generate more income for the family. 

Firoza decided to help her husband; thus, she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a new cycle-van to be used for expansion of her husband's business. She hopes this loaned amount will provide her with more income, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, Firoza and her husband want to buy land with the profit generated from the business.

Firoza and her husband, Rahim, are very much happy after getting the loan and thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To mass produce his design

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire employees and purchase supplies

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
There’s a lot of work that goes into a great lawn. Vincent spent years as a landscaper, learning the secrets behind a well manicured lawn. Vincent always wanted to pursue a business on his own. As his family grew, he decided starting his own business would provide more financial support for them.  With his knowledge and expertise, Vincent started Defined Cuts, a full-service landscaping company whose motto is “Defined by all we do.” 

Vincent’s business has quickly. In his second year of operation, he grew his revenue by $100,000. He has hired four employees and boasts a long list of satisfied customers. However, the lawn care industry is competitive, and Vincent is looking to grow his customer base even more.  With a loan, he is hoping to run a local marketing campaign to grab the attention of even more customers. 

Help Vincent grow his business and support his family!

loans.use: to launch a local marketing campaign

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jean hopes to expand soon, and she desires to give her child a better future. She meets weekly with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 3 years. Josephine earns additional income from selling food. 

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more makeup and accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to help her parents in purchasing construction materials to build the third floor of their house.

loans.name: Tovuz

texts.en:
Tovuz is 29 years old. She is married with a daughter, who will go to her first class in September. She is living in Fuzuli region-Dilagarda village, with husband and daughter. 

For 21 years Tovuz and her husband have been Internally Displaced Person from the city of Fuzuli. Tovuz sells personal products in a new open store. Today she wants to increase the family retail business, and for that needs a loan in the amount of 2,300 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN). With this amount Tovuz wants to open a daily food products section within the store: so that she buys goods and stands for new section of her store.

Tovuz hopes that this loan will develop her business and her monthly income will increase.

loans.use: to buy goods and stands for an open daily food products section

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds to plant trees in his garden

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвинe 42 года, она вместе с семьей проживает в небольшом городе Турсунзаде. Парвина 8 лет назад начала заниматься кройкой и шитьем женской одежды. За короткое время она научилась шить профессионально на специальных курсах. С того времени Парвина начала новую деятельность. Она стала брать заказы на шитье женских платьев. И посей день, она занимается этим бизнесом и довольна своей работой. Но есть одна проблема, которая мешает Парвине, сосредоточится на работе. Это ее швейная машинка. Машинка устарела и часто доставляет неудобство во время рабочего процесса. Парвина решила обратиться за кредитом и купить новую современную швейную машинку и тем самым облегчить себе работу. Парвина верит в Вашу поддержку, ведь для нее важна ее работа, потому что она занимается тем, что любит.
texts.en: Parvina is 42 years old and she lives with her family in the small city of Tursun-zoda.  Eight years ago, she started a business altering and sewing women's clothes.  After a while, she learned to sew professionally by taking special courses.  Since then, she has started a new business sewing women's dresses to order and she is very satisfied with the work she does.  But there is one problem related to Parvina's work that bothers her - it's her sewing machine.  Her machine has become old and it often gets in the way of her working process.  Parvina decided to ask for a loan so she can buy a new sewing machine to make her work easier.  She is counting on your support; her work is important to her because she does what she loves for a living.

loans.use: to buy a new modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi is 45 years old, married and has three children. He is living with his lovely family in the Baku region. Vidadi has a store; he has sold souvenirs and gift items in this store for four years. Today he wants to support his business, and for that he has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is planning to buy more products for selling with this amount. Vidadi says, “Thanks, dear Kiva organization and lenders. I hope that this loan will help to develop my business.” In the future, Vidadi wants to give a good education to his children

loans.use: to pay for more products for selling

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo is a repeat client of IMON. She is a very hardworking and industrious woman. Five years ago she began her own animal husbandry business. Shahlo feeds three cows at her house, where she has a cow shed. Shahlo feeds the cows for some months and then sells them in a local market. Her husband helps her with feeding. 

Shahlo works hard but still her income is small. Her family’s living conditions are poor. Shahlo is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en: Rosevilla is 44 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. She has an agricultural business of pig-fattening in the Philippines. Rosevilla requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. Rosevilla has been pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to help sustain her business. In the future, Rosevilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Virginia is borrowing 5,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a manufacturing (nipa hut) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Liza is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials like bamboo, binder, wood, and other tools.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to invest in more shops.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like bamboo, binder, wood, and other tools.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

Melanie has been in this business for three years now.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children. Both of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 46 years old. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Janet has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to dry which she will sell. Mildred has been in this business for 16 years. Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to dry.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Being greatly thankful for her first Kiva loan, Greta is asking for her second loan. Despite having a specialty of midwife, she became a very successful businesswoman. Greta now lives alone since she is a widow; her three daughters are married and they live separately with their families. 

Greta lives and works in Kapan city. She works in a rented stall where she sells men's and women's clothes, underwear, as well as children's and teenager's clothes. Thanks to her polite and kind attitude, patience and inexpensive prices, her customers never forget her. As they say, Greta already knows their taste and style, and they easily find any style of clothes they like. 

Greta will use this loan in order to buy a new assortment of clothes for children which will be in great demand with the beginning of the new school year.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes for children for the beginning of the new school year

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia works hard to support her family. Verginia is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

Verginia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Verginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine 30 years old, and she is married with two children aged between two and seven. One of her children goes to school. She has been selling  shoes for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 34 years old. She is married with two children, aged between nine and 11; all of them go to school. She has been running the retail business for the past 11 years. With the loan, she would like to buy  more lotions, cooking oil and hygienic items for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build their house.

loans.use: to buy more lotions, cooking oil and hygienic items for sale.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her husband in Kapan town of Syunik region. She keeps four cows and five calves in the barn which is too old and seriously damaged in some parts. She has requested this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase two cows and building materials for renovation of the barn. The loan will greatly help her to solve her farm's problems and she will be able to continue her livestock keeping business. 

As this is Anush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and building materials for renovation of the barn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Ali's Group's $3,000 loan is to purchase more electronic devices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Jean Rene

texts.en: Jean Rene has been working as mechanic and fisherman for a few years. He is one person well known in his locality and he sees an opportunity to start a renewable energy business. He would like to use a loan to purchase Eneji Pwop products and to resell them in his locality.  A Kiva loan will help him buy enough products to start this business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena 35 years old. She lives alone in Batumi, seaside of Georgia. Elena is unemployed at this moment. She is very hardworking and desires to have a stable income. 

Elena requested a loan for starting her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1,200. With the received credit she will open a shop and will have a monthly income. In her newly opened shop she will sell sugar, soft drinks, household goods and more. Elena will be able to improve her living conditions with increased income. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to open a shop in order to get monthly income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like fish, rice, meats, among others, to capitalize his business and build his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To hire labour for clearing and pruning and to buy fertilizer and fruit fly traps.

loans.name: Buuni Group

texts.en:
Shamis is a 45-year-old woman who has five children, three boys and two girls. She is the one raising her hand in the group photo. Shamis is the leader of a group named Buuni which consists of seven female members. Each of the group members has an existing small or medium-sized business in Borama  City.
 

Shamis has a medium-sized retail shop in Borama. Shamis all the other group members sell women clothes and perfumes but Shamis also sells TV screens, freezers, Men clothes, shoes, etc.  She is a very hard-working woman as she pays all her children’s school fees. Shamis has requested a loan of $700 from Kaaba MFI to expand her mixed goods shop. Buuni members are part of a group but each person has her loan separately, as they all have an existing business.

loans.use: To expand her Retail Clothing Shop

loans.name: Relampago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RELAMPAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wenddy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de pintura, venta de pollos a la broster, venta de zapatos deportivos, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, artesanía en plata, elaboración de cotillones, tostado de haba y platano.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wenddy es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de joyas; da a conocer que este negocio lo heredo de su papá quien realizaba esta producción desde que ella era niña, aprendiendo la técnica ella decide continuar el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de metal plata) que adquirirá de los vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el acceso fácil al crédito y la confianza que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The RELAMPAGO communal bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board where Wenddy serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include painting services, broasted chicken sales, athletic shoe sales, cosmetic sales, food sales, silver arts and crafts, cotollones sales, roasted beans and plantains.

This loan will help small businesses including Wenddy’s.  She started with Pro Mujer five years ago, on the invitation of an advisor who visited her home.  She makes and sells jewelry and says that she inherited this business from her father who did this when she was a girl.  She learned the techniques and decided to continue the business.

She will use the money from this loan to buy silver from the wholesalers in La Paz and use it to make and sell her wares from her space.  This will allow her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is the single mother of two.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the easy access to loans and the trust that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy silver.

loans.name: Urzula

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Urzula works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Urzula is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy meat, seafood, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business. Urzula has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, seafood, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ann

texts.en:
Maria Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline, fishing net, and other materials for fishing for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for one year. Maria Ann earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fishing net, and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Avelina has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice, raising pigs and buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Janice has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janice requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Janice has been in this business for five years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 31 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Avelina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Avelina has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a 58-year-old married woman with one dependent child. 

She owns and operates a store, selling charcoal, drinks and grocery items ((biscuits, noddles, cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, rice, bags of sugar and salt). She has been doing this for eight years. 

Dora needs a loan to buy charcoal, drinks and grocery items. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her child's education. 

She became a member of ID-Ghana in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, drinks and grocery (biscuits, noddles, cooking oil, tin tomatoes, rice, a bag of sugar and salt).

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
During the six months of maintaining pigs, Ni Made had no difficulties and problems. She sold her four fattening pigs, and she earned 400,000 IDR profit per month.This profit is increasing more than the previous period because the price for pork is also increasing this month. Because of having good results, her husband gives full support for her business. This effort has proven to fulfill her two children’s school needs.

Now, Ni Made and the other members of Tegal Badeng Indah group decided to have a new loan to continue their businesses. The group’s main goal is to have enough capital by saving, stop taking loans, and continue the businesses with their own capital.

The Tegal Badeng Indah group is receiving a new loan of 13,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used for increasing the number of piglets, renovate the barns, and purchase superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the businesses by themselves. Now they already have been saving and using it for capital.

Ni Made and the members of Tegal Badeng Indah group feel happy to receive support from lenders, Kiva, and MUK. Ni Made will use the loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork barbeque and purchase merchandise for her small kiosk. She hopes she can have enough savings soon and can continue the business by herself.

loans.use: to purchase four local piglets and merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet used her prior loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Juliet requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Her profits from her business will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. 

Juliet desires to become a successful businesswoman through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. Betty is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tires, paint, and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport.

Betty has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Betty would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tires, paint, and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie a hardworking entrepreneur with a fishing business in the Philippines, repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new one to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is re-listing Jessie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12, 13 y 17 años. Su cónyuge  propietario de una motocicleta viendo la necesidad pemanente de manteniemiento de estos vehiculos, decidió en el año 2010, venderla y sacarle provecho a la venta de repuestos para motos, actividad que asumió Carmen y con la que hoy genera ingresos adicionales para su hogar. Sus principales articulos que ofrece en el punto comercial de repuestos, son los bombillos, cadenas, neumaticos y accesorios que poco a poco ha ido agregando a su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito todos los dias, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, comprando a proveedores de almacenes que se ubican en la ciudad. Su meta mas adelante es contar con un almacen para ofrecer muchos mas articulos,  asociados a vehiculos automotores y lograr que sus hijos estudien una profesión, para lo cual su mayor desafio es mantener su negocio con altas ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará kit de carreteras, cadenas, guayas, neumaticos y otros repuestos que son de mucha rotación en su negocio. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues tendrá un muy buen inventario, que lo llevará al incrmento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in a municipality close to the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and their three children who are 12, 13 and 17 years old. Her husband, owning a motorbike and seeing the need for constant maintenance of these vehicles, decided in 2010 to sell it and take advantage of the opportunity to sell parts for motorbikes. Carmen took over, and so generates an additional income for their home.

The main items she offers in the spare parts business are light bulbs, chains, tires and accessories, which they have added to their business little by little. Their sales are by cash or credit, every day from 8 in the morning until 8 in the evening, buying from warehouse suppliers in the city.

Her aim going forward is to have a store to offer many more items associated with motor vehicles, and to see her children study a profession, so her greatest challenge is to maintain high sales in her business.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy  breakdown kits, chains, cable locks, tyres and other spare parts that are in high demand in her business. With this investment her business will improve as she will have a very good inventory which will lead to increased sales.

loans.use: to buy breakdown kits, chains, cable locks, tyres and other spare parts.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling veterinary products in the Philippines for three years now. She earns additional income from food vending.

Everlyn is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of veterinary products to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, and  dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase moere stocks of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline works hard to support her family. Madeline is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Madeline has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Madeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old and is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lolita has been in this business for twenty-seven years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc for her fishing business.

Marieta has been in this business for 3 years. Marieta earns additional income from raising pigs.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, wood.

loans.name: Zusima

texts.en:
Zusima is 45 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Zusima is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy an additional piglet to raise and feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Zusima has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet to raise and feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized roofing material, wood, and nails to do repairs on the kitchen.

loans.name: 31 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “31 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Arminda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de metal, taller de carpintería, venta de condimentos, venta de fotocopias, venta de tenis, venta de puertas, venta de flores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Arminda es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su tía que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra metales; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja, quien realizaba esta comercialización, este material lo utilizan para la elaboración de equipos industriales. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de metales por mayor) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community organization "31 De Julio" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center. It consists of 8 members and is run by a board of directors in which Arminda is the president. The businesses operated by the members of the community organization are varied and include: purchase and sale of metal, a carpentry workshop, selling condiments, sellling photocopies, selling sneakers, selling doors, and selling flowers.

The loan they're taking will benefit the group of micro-entrepreneurs of which Arminda is a member, she states that she's been part of Pro Mujer for four years when she joined after being invited by her aunt, a customer of the institution. Currently she has a metal purchasing business; she says she learned this business from her spouse, who was doing these sales, and they use the material to make industrial equipment.

The loan she's now taking is to increase the working capital (by wholesale purchase of metal) she will obtain from distribution companies in the city of El Alto and subsequently place in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she's in a commonlaw marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and heath services offered by the institution.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale metal.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana tiene 41 años de edad  y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijas de 18 años, 15 años y 12 años de edad. Ana se gana la vida por medio de la venta de cocos que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo. Dicha actividad le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Ana desea reparar el techo de un cuarto dado que el que posee se encuentra en mal estado y cuando es tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para proceder a realizar la mejora del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her three daughters who are 18, 15 and 12 years old. She earns a living by selling coconuts which she has been doing for a long time. This activity allows her to put food on the table for her family. 

Ana would like to repair the roof of one of the rooms in her house because it is in poor condition and it leaks during the rainy season. This is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan which she will use to buy galvanized roofing material, wood, and nails to begin work on fixing the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized roofing material, wood, and nails to fix the roof of a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods, breads, biscuits, beverages, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Eva has been in this business for 20 years. Eva earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 42 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Annabelle has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Irene has been in this business for 11 years. Irene earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 56 years old and is a widow with four children. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nida has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alona is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Alona has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Alona has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Alona would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Flor De Rosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de quinua, tejido de mantas, venta de deportivos, venta de refrescos, venta de jugos de quinua, venta de carne de cordero.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien tenía el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar este negocio, ya que conocí la forma de manejo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño) que adquirirá de los vendedoras mayoristas de las comunidades del Departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The FLOR DE ROSA communal bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board where Basilla serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include cosmetic sales, Quinoa sales, blanket knitting, sporting goods sales, soft drink sales, juice sales, and lamb sales.

This loan will help small businesses including Basilla’s.  She says this will be her first time with Pro Mujer, having started, on the invitation of an advisor who visited her home.  She sells potatoes and chuño (freeze dried potato product) and says that she learned this business from her mother who had a similar business.  In time she decided to start this business because she knew how to run it.  

She will use the money from this loan to buy chuño from the wholesalers in La Paz and use it to make and sell her wares from her space.  This will allow her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is in a common law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training offered.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chuño

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies for her tailor shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase metal bars for the windows of her porch.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and married with three children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty-five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Gloria aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Nieves is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sugar, rice, milk and other ingredients for her food vending business.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, milk and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Minerva has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Minerva has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her family. Concepcion is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sweet potatoes, bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

Concepcion has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sweet potatoes, bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es: Heidy de 45 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de comidas refrescos, jugos de frutas naturales etc. desde hace 14 años, cuando vendo a su madre aprendió, la ayudó en su edad avanzada y finalmente, cuando llegó el momento en que su madre decidió,  tomó las riendas del negocio y hasta el momento no se ha apartado  de él . En su oferta Heidy vende además de almuerzos, frituras, gaseosas, cervezas, a vecinos y familiares,  ubicados en el sector donde habita , Su meta es adquirir herramientas de trabajo,  que mejoren su capacidad productiva  y aumentar la cobertura de clientes, además de adecuar su vivienda.
