En la actualidad Heidy ha visitado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, primer financiamiento al que aplica, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, así como también gaseosas y frutas,  para elaborar jugos. Con esta inversión ampliará sus inventarios y así mismo la cobertura de su clientela, mejorando  de esta manera su negocio.
texts.en:
45-year-old Heidy has worked in the sale of soft drinks, natural fruit juices, etc. for 14 years when she was watching her mother. She learned, she helped her mother in her advanced age, and finally, when the moment arrived that her mother decided, she took the reins of the business and since that moment she hasn't parted from it. In her business Heidy additionally sells lunches, fried foods, sodas, and beers to neighbors and family members, located in the area where she lives. Her goal is to acquire business tools that improve her productive capacity and improve increase the range of clientes, in addiction to adjusting her home.

Currently Heidy has visited the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for a Kiva loan, the first financing she's applied for, with which she will buy raw materials and supplies, as well as sodas and fruits to prepare juices. With this investment she will increase her inventory and so the range of her clientele, in this way improving her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies as well as sodas and fruits to prepare juices

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. For one year now, Nelly has been running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beef to then resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, a 35-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years, and earns additional income from food vending.

Helen, who has borrowed and repaid two prevoius loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 15000 to buy more stocks to sell such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

Helen aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Josepina

texts.en:
Josepina is 64 years old and widowed with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

Josepina has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Teresita has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase duralite, iron, and nails in order to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Charie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending. Charie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Charie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlita has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Christina

texts.en:
Maria Christina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business for her fishing business.

Maria Christina has been in this business for 7 years. Maria Christina earns additional income from buying and selling curtains.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emerita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Emerita has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 40 años, es separada de su pareja, vive en casa propia con 02 hijos de los cuales el mayor estudia y trabaja y la menor solo estudia en instituto. Margarita es una persona con buenas referencias por parte de su familia Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 45 kms de Chiclayo, en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú y que es habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

Margarita se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, chivos, cerdos, etc., desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente, además realiza trabajos de costura desde hace más de 05 años, ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en arreglo del lugar donde cria a sus animales(corralitos), para de esta manera criarlos en mejores condiciones para que al momento de la venta pueda hacerlos a un mejor y buen precio, lo que le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus gananacias, y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old, separated, and lives in her own house with two children. The older one studies and works, and the younger one studies at the institute. Margarita's family speaks well of her. She lives in a community located 45 km. from Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. The people there are respectful and mostly work in commerce, agriculture and livestock.

Margarita has been raising and selling small animals such as ducks, goats, pigs, etc. for more than three years approximately. She also has been a seamstress for more than five years. She needs the loan to invest in building pens to raise her animals so she will be able to raise them under better conditions and thus fetch a better price when she sells them. This will help to increase her income, improve her earnings and improve her quality of life and that of her children.

loans.use: to invest in building pens to raise her animals.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 39 years old, not married and he lives with his parents. For many years he has worked in farming, with his main crop being lemons. The work is going very well as Elnur has many years' experience and because he always worries about giving his customers the highest quality products. But he has a problem with water because every time he gets water from a neighbor. 

For this reason he is asking for a loan of 1,200 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his lemon crops.

Elnur is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling fish in the Philippines. She requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Elizabeth is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a photography business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her photography business.

Arlene has been in this business for 5 years.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Beourn

texts.en:
A man who lives in Preah Vihear province, Beourn is 29 years old and he is a father of two children who are too young for schooling. He strives for a living via rice farming. Besides this business, his family can earn a decent income from his occupation as a policeman. 

This is first time for him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he will spend his entire loan portion to buy a solar panel to generate electricity for his family’s daily consumption. He really hopes that he can have electricity as other people.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel to generate electricity for his family’s daily consumption.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chey Sen District

loans.name: Shwe Su Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yin Mar Pin township, this community currently has 31 village customers, including 9 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. Currently, this community is having difficulties with drought. Mostly, they have to rely on rain water for their animals and home. Water supply from the well is not enough for the entire village. This year, due to the weather inconsistency, villagers' yields of popular crops such as sesame and green gram are lower than expected.

This new loan would enable this community to invest in raising and selling livestock, such as pigs. Villagers prefer to raise pigs and sell them back for profit. One small pig is about $50 and can be sold back at $120 after raising it for about one year. This profit would help them buy farming inputs, such as seeds or fertilizer, or support family expenses, such as health emergencies and school fees. Livestock is their second source of income after farming for these villagers and is less reliant on weather. For additional income, villagers will operate small grocery stores and send their children to the cities to work in ports.

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U San, U Kyaw, U Aung (leader), U Win , U Zaw , U Chit, U Hla, U Kyaw Kyar, and U Khin. Included in the photo is U Aung (third from the left), the 61-year-old father of one child. His main business is cultivating paddy, millet and sunflowers. As his son is a university student, he has to support his educational expenses. This new loan would help him to purchase two small pigs to raise and sell back for profit. He will use some parts of the loan to buy high quality seeds.

loans.use: to help 31 villagers raise and sell livestock, such as pigs

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 37; living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a plumber; he has been providing services for many years and fulfilling all the expenses of his family alone. He provides the services for underground piping connections, fitting taps, and digging wells. He retained a list of good customers in a short time and his business is going well. His tools have been wearing out; he wants to buy new tools such as a wrench, a tube cutter, a pipe threader, tube flaring, a soldering torch, a tile spade, a shovel, a digging bar etc. to continue his services but he does not have enough cash in hand.  Therefore, Khalida has requested a loan to help her husband so he can buy tools for his plumber services.

Khalida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for plumber services such as a wrench, a tube cutter, a pipe threader, tube flaring, a soldering torch, a tile spade, a shovel, a digging bar.

loans.name: Sokkea Group

texts.en: In the photo, the small girl is the client’s daughter. Sokkea is 34 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. All of her children are students. She has been a farmer since 2000. Her husband is 35 years old and a motor taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $8 per day. Now Sokkea would like to request a loan as a group of three members and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better and more healthy conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her rice cultivation and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Julitah

texts.en:
Julitah, a widowed mother of three, describes herself as honest. She has been selling potatoes in a rural area for eight years. 

Having repaid her previous loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, Julitah is requesting her second one for Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stocks of potatoes. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of potatoes within five years, and she hopes that in the future, she will be successful in her enterprise.

loans.use: buy more stocks of potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cases and cell phone accessories like screen protectors and packaging for its protection, simcards, chargers, and spare parts among others.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 77 years old and a widowed mother of ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Julieta has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Julieta has been in this business for twenty-two years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 49-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, education and health.

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has a few years experience in this field. Her son assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years.

She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fifth loan cycle but it will be the first loan with Kiva and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Kyar Kan (Taltike) Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 27 village customers, including 4 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. Farmers usually grow groundnuts, sesame, millet, and pigeon peas. As most of them are Buddhists, the village must save for regular cultural ceremonies, such as offering provisions to monks.  Additionally, access to finance is limited in this region, as the country's largest provider, the state-owned agricultural bank, is not active in this region.

The new loan would enable borrowers to purchase pesticides and vitamins in order to produce high quality crops. They usually have to spend about 40 USD to buy the pesticides and vitamins needed for one acre. They also raise cows to help on their farms, and goats to resell for a profit. With profits from these income-generating activities, villagers hope to address the community's social issues, such as providing access to cheap clean water, as buying water to drink costs about 3 USD a week, and buying a solar light to utilize at night, as there is no electricity supply in the village.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Kyar Kan Taltike Village CBO: U Myo, U Aye, U Yin, and Daw S. Included in the photo (first from the right) is U Aye, who is the 45-year-old father of one child. He will invest his loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, which will boost his crop yields, and therefore his crop sales, this season. This extra income will help fund his son's educational expenses.

loans.use: to help 27 villagers purchase pesticides and vitamins to boost crop yields

loans.name: Tet Wun (South)

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has thirty village customers, including five CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. As the area is suffering from uncommon rainfall and a lack of water in the community water basin, crop yields are lower than expected and households must buy drinking water, costing them about $3 a week.  The largely Buddhist community is also raising money to renovate the monastery and pagoda in the village.

The new loan will help these borrowers raise livestock, which is the secondary income source after farming crops such as millet and green gram.  Villagers would like to use this loan to buy pigs and goats. Some people who have chicken farms can also invest their loan to expand their business, as the upfront costs are very high.  There are other income generating businesses in the village, such as tapping toddy palm, selling groceries, tailoring at home, and seeking formal employment in urban centers. 

Pictured above are the committee members from the Tat Won (S) CBO: U Aye, U Khine, U Zaw, U Aung, and Daw Mya. Included in the photo is U Khine, who is a thirty-two-year-old farmer.  With his new loan, he will purchase crop seeds such as sesame and groundnuts. As he is also planning to start a chicken farm, part of his loan will be used to buy chicken feed, which sells for about $40 a bag.

loans.use: to help 30 villagers to raise pigs, goats, and chickens

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to own a clinic within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be humble. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more vegetables to stock. 

Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. He will use the loan of 80,000 KES to buy more timber. His business goal is to own a modern carpentry workshop within five years. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to enhance his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, steel and silver jewelry, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tarez

texts.en:
Tarez is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman from Beit Sahour, a village near Bethlehem city. She is a mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. Her husband has a pastry store in the city. Tarez also works to help her husband pay monthly expenses. Twenty years ago, she started working in making religious souvenirs from olive wood. She is very talented and the demand for these artistic products is high.

Tarez took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive wood for her workshop. By taking this loan, Tarez will be able to increase her products and also her income. 

Tarez appears in the photo in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy more olive wood for her workshop

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ice candy making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy making business.

Lucila successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lucila's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy making.

loans.name: Mageline

texts.en:
Mageline is 47 years old, married, and has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mageline has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mageline aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a fifty-one-year-old lady who lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save money so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her son has been driving a motor rickshaw from several years but his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the body of the rickshaw but does not have enough cash in hand to do so. 

Haleema has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her son can buy a new body for his motor rickshaw. She hopes that she can save enough money before her son gets married.

loans.use: To buy the body section of a motor rickshaw

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse and three sons. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklace, rings and earrings. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  

He has only one source of income to cover utility bills, the children's school fees and household expenses. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living. He would like to reconstruct his house but he needs to save enough money to do so. This is why he needs to earn more.

Anwer has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can increase the inventory on daily basis and consequently save more as well. She hopes that she can reconstruct her house soon, so that her family members can live their lives more comfortably.

Anwer is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her some hope that she will fulfil her desires.

loans.use: to buy artificial jewelry for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Mandarin oranges, apples, and pineapples to stock his small business and to be able to give his wife a better condition of life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials, an electric saw, and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en: Amjad is a 22-year-old, single young man from a village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. The family also has a barn for raising sheep and all of them cooperate and work in the business together. Amjad requested a loan from FATEN to help him buy more sheep for the family barn. This loan will allow Amjad to improve the family business and increase its productivity. Amjad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the family barn.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock. 

She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has 8 children. She describes herself to be disciplined. Lilian operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Lilian's business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Germán tiene 58 años de edad y desde hace 31 años se  gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios de seguridad en una playa cercana a su localidad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su familia, conformada por su esposa, su hijo de 24 años  y su nieta de 10 años de edad. Germán desea mejorar las condiciones del techo del corredor de la vivienda  dado que por el momento está construido a base de palma de coco. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Germán is 58 years old and for 31 years he has earned a living by providing security services at a beach near to his town. He's a very hardworking man who has done everything in his power to earn a living for his family, made up of his wife, his 24-year-old son, and his 10-year-old niece. 

Germán wants to improve the conditions of the roof of the dining room of his home, given that for the moment it's constructed with a foundation of coconut palm. For that, he asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, wood, and nails to change the roof of the dining room of the house

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 61 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lucia has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables and raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fiel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fiel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Fiel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruit to sell for her  business.

Fiel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 57 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs, coffee, and soap.

Elsie has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing and raising pigs. Elsie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, chips, eggs, coffee, and soap.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. Ester works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, charcoal, firewood, etc.

Ester has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Ester would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, charcoal, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Zipporah, a mother of two lovely children and a very hard-working woman. She is based in Gesoni, a remote village in the rich Kisii highlands, an area with fertile soils and famous for banana growing. Their staple food is “matoke,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from banana. 

Zipporah has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years.  Selling eggs and milk has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. Zipporah passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Zipporah is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela’s husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw and pays a daily sum because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children alone. Nabeela has been putting aside savings for many days to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband but at the time of purchasing, some money came up short. 

Therefore, Nabeela has requested a Kiva loan for her husband so that he can buy a rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  She hopes that now her husband will not have any need to pay a daily sum which becomes the cause of his low income. Nabeela is a 38-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Nabeela hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because she is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: Cindy de 21 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente actualmente  se encuentra en etapa escolar. El grupo “Inmaculada Concepción”  está conformada por  08 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables. Ella se dedica a los servicios de tipeos y redacción de documentos como cartas, oficios y solicitudes. Se siente orgullosa por darle una mejor educación a su único hijo. Posteriormente piensa poner una librería lo cual le es una oportunidad para seguir progresando. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de papel, tóner y lapicero. El grupo “Inmaculada Concepción” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Cindy se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo plomo.
texts.en:
Cindy is 21 years old and is separated with one dependent, school-age child. The "Inmaculada Concepción" group is made up of eight enterprising and responsible women. Cindy provides the service of typing and writing documents such as letters, official notices, and requests. She is proud to be able to provide a better education to her only child.

Later she plans to start a bookstore which will be an opportunity to continue to progress. She asked for the loan to buy paper, toner, and pens.

The “Inmaculada Concepción” group is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible. Cindy is the one seated, first on the left, wearing a gray shirt.

loans.use: to buy paper, toner, and pens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Riya

texts.en:
Riya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Riya earns additional income from raising pigs.

Riya is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 64 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Salvacion earns more income from a general store.

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell fruits and vegetables business. Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Felisa works hard to support her family. She farms coconuts in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Felisa is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her coconut farm.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 44-year-old married woman. Her financial conditions are very bad. 

Asia's husband recently started to drive a moto-rickshaw which does not belong to him. He wants to stop paying out the daily rent for it and has a desire to buy his own rickshaw. He has his personal bike which he wants to convert into a moto-rickshaw so he can easily generate income for his family. A moto-rickhaw's body is cheap  but he does not have even that small amount. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for a moto-rickshaw.

To motivate her husband; Asia has requested a loan so he can buy the new rickshaw body and start driving.

loans.use: to buy a new moto-rickshaw body.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Shafqat sews the clothes of her neighbors, relatives, and locality persons. She is a fine tailor, and this is the reason she has attained a good list of new customers.

To help her continue operations of her business, Shafquat has requested a loan to buy a profession sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuously working. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.
Shafqat thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for tailoring at home.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Four years ago Beatrice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kimulot, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Beatrice believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production and she will save more money that she used to spend on treating her cows because of lacking a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Tito Alonso

texts.es: Tito tiene 57 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 23 años, 21 años y 10 años de edad. Tito se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy visionario quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  Tito ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de un cuarto dormitorio de su vivienda para lo cual necesita comparar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Tito is 57 years old and lives in a home of his own with his life’s partner and three children, ages 23, 21, and 10.  Tito is known for being a very visionary man who does everything within his reach to provide a better quality of life for his family.  Tito is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, to repair the roof over a bedroom in his home.  He will buy galvanized metal, lumber, and nails.

loans.use: to repair a roof.

loans.name: Marina Del Transito

texts.es: Marina tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 7 años de edad. Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitaacionales y las de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda  para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos y así poder proteger sus poscas pertenencias y a su familia de las lluvias.
texts.en:
Marina is 25 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their 7-year-old daughter. She is a very hard-working woman who does everything within her power to give her family the best living conditions.

Desiring to improve their living conditions and the family's well-being, she has made the decision to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in repairing the roof of their house. She will need to buy such materials as galvanized roofing material, wood, and nails so they can protect the family and their few belongings from the rain.

loans.use: to buy galvanized roofing material, wood, and nails to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 42-years-old.  She is a married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning for its regular routine. 

For this reason, Zareena has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and complete a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.
Zareena thanks both Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has two children. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Peter hopes that in the future, his farm will produce high yields. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is 36 years old and a mother of three. She owns and manages a small retail store to help her husband in gaining income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to further improve the business to increase her income. She wants to acquire more stocks of groceries to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell. Felicidad is hoping to use the loan to help improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Tet Wun (North)

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including five CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. For this village, rainfall is uncommon, which threatens crop yields.  Additionally, as the community well is not functioning properly, villagers have to pay about $3 for water each week.

This new loan will help the community purchase a small tractor, which costs about $7,000. In addition to expediting the planting and harvesting processes, owning a tractor will reduce villagers' current expenses, such as renting tractors from nearby villagers, leasing bulls from neighbors, and buying animal feed for these animals.  Some parts of the loan will be used to raise livestock, such as goats or pigs, which provide natural manures to replace expensive chemical fertilizers and can be resold for a profit. In the future, villagers also want to set up an ice machine and drink business to generate extra income for their families. 

Pictured above are the committee members from the Tat Won (North) village CBO: U Tun, U Hla, U Tin, U Aung, and Daw Aye. Included in the photo (third from the left) is U Tun, who is a 36-year-old father of one child. His new loan will help him raise livestock. Sometimes, he also works as a mechanic and sells livestock feed to other villages. With his additional income, he wants to purchase a handset phone, which will help him speak with his customers and monitor market prices.

loans.use: to help 29 villagers buy a small tractor for village use.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Ana se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón  desde hace 6 años. Ella es una mujer visionaria quien cada día se preocupa por dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Ana desea  reparar el techo a la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana, age 49, lives in her own house with her life partner and her 12 year old son, who goes to school.  Ana has been selling cashews for six years.  She is a visionary woman, who worries every day about giving her family better living conditions.

Ana wishes to repair the roof of the house.  That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 41 years old and blessed with only one child. She has owned and managed a small retail store in her local community for almost four years. She aims to improve more of her business and increase her income to cover-up their daily necessities. She wants to increase her product offerings but she has limited capital. For this reason, Violeta would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more soft drinks, frozen foods, rice, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, and snack foods to resell. Through this loan, she believes that someday she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, frozen foods, rice, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, and snack foods to resell.

loans.name: Cicily

texts.en:
Cicily is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as future oriented. She operates a farm on which she grows crops. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of funds. She will use this 30,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. 

Cicily hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. Joyce operates a farm where she grows rice. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger harvest. This is Joyce's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mercina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mercina works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Mercina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell at her buy and sell fish business.

Mercina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is receiving a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her embroidery work at home. She has been doing embroidery for many years and feeding her children. She is a responsible mother; she knows about her duties and responsibilities toward her children very well. She always keeps busy and is ready to provide better conditions for her dear children.

Bilqees is 45 years old and the mother of eight children. Her daughters help her complete her tasks.To cope with increasing demand, Bilqees has requested a loan  from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase raw materials. 

Bilqees does not want to lose heart and wants to be able to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and her family. Bilqees is very happy and relaxed after receiving this loan because it will increase her monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 45-year-old married woman. She has six children: two daughters and four sons. She is striving hard to support them, which includes providing food and health care. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.
 
Zarina started her business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income, and she is very familiar with stitching techniques. She has requested a loan to buy spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles so can meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to expand her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven quien se gana la vida trabajando como jornalero en una hacienda cercana a su localidad. Juan desea construir un servicio sanitario con ducha para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: arena, cemento, ladrillo, grava, taza, grifo, etc. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la construcción.
texts.en: Juan is 21 years old and lives in a home of his own with his family.  He is a young man who earns a living as a laborer in a nearby home.  Juan wants to build a bathroom with a shower and is asking for a loan, through, FUSAI, to buy cement, bricks, gravel, a toilet, faucet, etc.  He hopes to get access to this financing so he can begin construction.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, laminated metal sheeting, wood, and nails in order to make the improvements to his house.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo, se dedica a manejar un microbus  ya que de ahí puede sacar sus ingresos para su sustento diario de su familia, ya que él no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres no le dieron la importancia necesaria a su estudio, pero aprendió el oficio de motorista gracias a sus amigos que le dieron la oportunidad de aprender, ya que hoy también se dedica a la agricultura para poder obtener los granos básicos para sus sustento diario.

Fidel tiene mucha experiencia en su trabajo, que realiza como motorista ya que tiene experiencia y maneja con mucha precaución, en la agricultura trabaja desde muy pequeño con su papá,fue el oficio que le enseño desde muy pequeño


El préstamo que esta solicitando  CREDICAMPO, para cultivar una 12 tareas de maíz,  para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar y también necesita arreglar unas piezas al microbus, ya que es su herramienta que utiliza diariamente para ganarse el pan de cada día.

 Fidel planea hacer sus cultivos siempre para la demanda de alimentos en su hogar y si todo le sale bien seguir trabajando con los créditos y poder comprar un microbus propio para obtener mejores ganancias y poder ayudar a su hijo en la educación y no se quede sin estudiar como él.
texts.en:
Fidel is 26 years old and lives with his wife and son.  He drives a minibus which is how he earns money to support his family. He did not have the opportunity to go to school since his parents did not think that education was important. He learned how to be a driver from his friends. Fidel is also a farmer and grows basic grains for daily sustenance. Fidel is very experienced in his work as a driver and drives very carefully. He learned farming from his father at an early age.

He is asking CREDICAMPO for a loan so that he can buy some parts for his minibus which is his tool that he uses every day to earn a living. He also needs the money to cultivate 12 plots of corn which he grows for household use.

Fidel plans to always continue to farm to meet his household need for food, and if all goes well, to continue getting loans so he can buy his own minibus and earn more income. He wants to be able to help his son get an education so that he does not wind up uneducated like him.

loans.use: to fix some parts on his minibus which he uses every day to earn a living. He will also use some of the money to cultivate 12 plots of corn for household consumption.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es: René de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa  y sus hijos, el se dedica al trabajo de radiotécnico, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, René solicita un crédito para la compra de herramientas y repuestos para el taller de radiotécnico y asi poder seguir con su trabajando para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
René is 37 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and children. He works as a radio technician and what he earns from his job allows him to cover some of his household needs.

René is requesting a loan in order to buy tools and parts for his radio repair shop. This will enable him to continue working so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools and parts for his repair shop.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Shee is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Claressa May

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Claressa May works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Claressa May is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy lumber to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Claressa May has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy lumber to sell for her business
